documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

recommendation: Step up career guidance activities to encourage girls and young women to choose non-traditional fields of study and career paths

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Revise schoolbooks and other teaching materials and remove, as a matter of priority, any discriminatory gender stereotypes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

recommendation: Take measures to increase the participation of women in formal employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase efforts to encourage and support women’s economic empowerment and entrepreneurship, especially among rural women, including by providing access to credit, land and other resources and training in microenterprise development and management, and monitor the impact of those initiatives on women

recommendation: ensure that rural women have adequate access to land and related resources, social, health and other basic services, economic opportunities and new technologies, as well as equal opportunities to participate in political and public life, in particular in decision-making processes at the community level

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in rural areas
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that women and men are able to participate on an equal footing in the political sphere and in the public affairs of the State. It urges the State party to introduce a range of legal, political and administrative measures, in accordance with the provisions of article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation 25, in order to improve the access of women to decision-making and their equal representation in all political, elective and administrative functions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take the steps necessary to increase the percentage of women occupying leadership positions in all sectors of the society and to make regular assessments of the effectiveness of those steps

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accelerate its efforts to increase the presence of women in the diplomatic service using temporary special measures such as information campaigns in universities targeting female students, and to report on the progress achieved in its next periodic report.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its measures to make sure that women have access to full-time and permanent jobs and to achieve equal pay for work of equal value

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify efforts to modify the Criminal Code with a view to qualifying sexual abuse as a violent crime rather than as a crime against morality

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accord priority attention to the adoption of comprehensive measures to address violence against women in accordance with the Committee’s general recommendation 19 on violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the full implementation of legislation on violence against women, as well as the prosecution and conviction of perpetrators

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt and implement a unified and multifaceted national strategy to eliminate violence against women and girls, which would include legal, educational, financial and social components

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of training activities and programmes for parliamentarians, the judiciary and public officials, particularly law enforcement personnel, teachers and health-service providers, so as to sensitize them to all forms of violence against women and girls and to provide adequate support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of public awareness-raising campaigns on all forms of violence against women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enhance its cooperation with non-governmental organizations working in the area of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake research on all forms of violence against immigrant, refugee and minority women and girls and implement policies and programmes to address those human rights violations adequately

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include specific data and information about forced marriage and assess the impact of those measures in its next report

recommendation: strengthen its efforts to strictly enforce the law banning female genital mutilation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that all migrant women can seek protection from domestic violence and halt deportation procedures in this context

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend the Criminal Code with a view to qualifying sexual abuse as a crime against the person rather than an offence against public morality and family order

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect statistical data on all forms of violence against women, disaggregated by age, ethnicity, nationality and relationship between the victim and the perpetrator

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Establish specialized centres (one-stop shops) for victims of sexual violence, where they can receive immediate medical and forensic examinations to collect evidence, medical treatment, psychological counselling and legal assistance in filing a complaint

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Study the reasons for the underreporting of cases of rape and the high number of rape and domestic violence charges dropped, in order to inform the development of policies and strategies to address this issue, including policies to build the trust of women who are victims of violence in the police and in the law enforcement system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite the ratification of the Istanbul Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Grant temporary residence permits to women and girls who are victims of trafficking, regardless of their ability or willingness to cooperate with prosecution authorities and to file a complaint

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase efforts to investigate, prosecute and punish traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that adequate human and financial resources are allocated to policies and programmes to combat trafficking in persons

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue efforts to ensure that victims of trafficking have effective access to medical care, psychosocial counselling, legal assistance and rehabilitation and reintegration programmes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination to prevent trafficking through the exchange of information and the harmonization of legal procedures for prosecuting and punishing traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Carry out a study on the prevalence of prostitution in the State party and address the root causes of the prostitution of women and girls in order to eliminate their vulnerability to sexual exploitation and trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to discourage the demand for prostitution, including by considering the criminalization of the purchase of sexual services

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Assist women and girls who wish to leave prostitution by providing alternative income-generating opportunities, among other measures

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures, such as statutory quotas, to guarantee the equal representation of men and women, in particular that of women belonging to ethnic and minority groups, in appointed positions in the federal Government and in the governments of the federated entities, as well as in the diplomatic service and in international organizations

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: reinforce the mechanisms that it has established for the private sector in order to better address the underrepresentation of women in all types of enterprises

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify efforts aimed at diversifying academic and vocational choices for women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take further measures to encourage women and men to choose non-traditional fields of education and careers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that all gender stereotypes are eliminated from textbooks, that school curricula, academic programmes and professional training for teachers cover women’s rights and promote gender equality and that gender studies courses are introduced at higher levels

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Encourage applications by women for teaching positions at higher levels of education and accelerate the appointment of women in academic institutions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct a study on the extent and the root causes of school dropouts among girls of migrant background that will inform policy interventions to guarantee their retention in educational institutions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to take specific and proactive measures to eliminate occupational segregation and to reduce the gender pay gap, including by ensuring the strict application of the law of 2012 aimed at reducing the gender wage gap

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider undertaking a first evaluation within the next four years and carry out regular evaluations of the impact of the law of 2011 on women’s participation on the management boards of listed companies and autonomous public enterprises, and include information on the results of those evaluations in its next periodic report; and consider taking temporary special measures to accelerate women’s participation at the decision-making level in companies that are not covered by the law

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that women have effective access to justice in cases of discrimination on grounds of pregnancy and motherhood and in cases of sexual harassment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Carry out a study on the prevalence of gender-based discrimination in the social security system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that, in practice, there is not any non-consensual sterilization of women with intellectual and/or psychosocial disabilities who have been deprived of their legal capacity or have limited legal capacity, and that those women are provided with the support necessary to decide whether they wish to give their informed consent to sterilization

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend all relevant criminal codes to include a definition of wartime sexual violence in line with international standards, including a specific definition of rape as a war crime and a crime against humanity, in order to adequately reflect the gravity of the crimes committed and intensify its efforts to harmonize the jurisprudence and sentencing practices of its courts throughout the State party, by establishing effective cooperation mechanisms between prosecutors and courts competent to deal with war crimes at all levels of the State party

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite the adoption of pending draft laws and programmes designed to ensure effective access to justice for all women victims of wartime sexual violence, including adequate reparation, such as the draft law on the rights of victims of torture and civilian war victims, the programme for victims of sexual violence in conflict and torture (2013-2016) and the draft strategy on transitional justice aimed at improving access to justice

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Develop a comprehensive approach to improve the status and position of all women victims of the war, including by combating the stigma attached to sexual violence; and expand the provision of compensation, support and rehabilitation measures and benefits, and ensure equal access to such services for all women victims, irrespective of their place of residence

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Remove, as a matter of priority, gender stereotypes from educational textbooks and teaching materials

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Disseminate the principles of non-discrimination and gender equality throughout the educational system, both formal and informal, with a view to enhancing a positive and non-stereotypical portrayal of women, by incorporating human rights and gender equality into training and educational materials and by providing training on women’s rights to teaching staff

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Develop a comprehensive, wide-ranging strategy across all sectors, with proactive and sustained measures, targeted at women and men, girls and boys, to overcome patriarchal and gender-based stereotypical attitudes about the roles and responsibilities of women and men in the family and in society, in particular in areas where women are in the most disadvantaged position, such as public and political life and employment

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Establish effective institutional mechanisms to coordinate, monitor and assess the effectiveness of the impact of the strategies developed and measures taken with a view to ensuring the consistent application of the laws at all levels

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to ensure that all reported cases of domestic and sexual violence against women and girls are effectively investigated and that perpetrators are prosecuted and sentenced commensurate with the gravity of the crime

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect statistical data on domestic violence, including femicide, disaggregated by sex, age and relationship between victim and perpetrator, and undertake research on the extent of all forms of violence against women and its root causes

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide mandatory training for judges, lawyers and law enforcement officers on the uniform application of the existing legal framework, including on the definition of domestic violence and on gender stereotypes

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide adequate assistance, protection and rehabilitation to women victims of all forms of violence, including by strengthening the capacity of existing shelters and by enhancing cooperation with and funding for non-governmental organizations providing shelter and rehabilitation to victims

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the effective implementation of the new legislative framework and the timely prosecution and punishment of traffickers, as well as review its sentencing policy in trafficking cases

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide mandatory and gender-sensitive training for judges, prosecutors, police officers and other law enforcement officers on applicable legal provisions, including regulations on the protection of witnesses of trafficking

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen mechanisms aimed at the early identification and referral of victims of trafficking, with a special focus on Roma and internally displaced women

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen preventive measures (to combat trafficking) such as raising awareness about the risks of trafficking for disadvantaged groups of women

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure adequate funding for anti-trafficking activities undertaken by non-governmental organizations

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend legislation to ensure that women victims of prostitution are no longer punished by a fine

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the investigation, prosecution and punishment of those who exploit prostitution

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to discourage the demand for prostitution

recommendation: Pursue a comprehensive approach to addressing the exploitation of prostitution, including by developing strategies to support and provide rehabilitation for women who wish to leave prostitution

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: Combined fourth and fifth periodic reports

documenttype: Communicatoin No. 20/2008

documenttype: Communicatoin No. 20/2008

reportconsidered: Combined fourth, fith, sixth, and seventh periodic reports

recommendation: provide funding for anti-trafficking activities by non-governmental organizations

documenttype: Communication No. 31/2011

recommendation: To repeal article 158 of the Criminal Code, and to ensure that all acts of sexual violence against women and girls, especially rape, are defined in line with international standards and effectively investigated and that perpetrators are prosecuted and sentenced commensurately with the gravity of their crimes

recommendation: amend the 2006 Legal Aid Act to provide legal aid for the execution of judgements awarding compensation to victims of sexual violence

documenttype: Communication No. 31/2011
recommendation: Provide an adequate mechanism for provision of compensation for moral damages to victims of gender-based violence, including through amending the Law on support and financial compensation to crime victims

documenttype: Communication No. 31/2011

documenttype: Communication No. 31/2011
recommendation: ensure the enactment and application of policies, including health-care protocols and hospital procedures to address sexual violence against women and girls

documenttype: Communication No. 31/2011
recommendation: give due consideration to the views of the Committee, together with its recommendations, and shall submit to the Committee, within six months, a written response, including any information on any action taken in the light of the views and recommendations of the Committee

recommendation: publish the Committee’s views and recommendations and to have them widely distributed in order to reach all relevant sectors of society

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

recommendation: amend the legal definition of rape to bring it into line with accepted international standards

recommendation: provide all victims (of forced sterilization) with assistance in gaining access to their medical records

womensrightsissue: Equality in health and Violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prosecute and adequately punish those who illegally practised coercive or non-consensual sterilizations

womensrightsissue: Equality in health and Violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: appoint an independent committee to research the full extent of the harm caused by the practice of involuntary sterilization, and support continuing outreach to all potential applicants for compensation

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proactive measures in order to improve significantly the representation of women in politics at regional and local levels and to achieve full gender equality in Parliament

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt appropriate temporary special measures in order to increase the number of women in politics, in particular at the regional and local levels in the State party, including the Faroe Islands and Greenland

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase the number of women in high-ranking posts, particularly in academia

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt effective proactive measures to encourage more women to apply for high-ranking posts and it encourages the State party to draw on the University of Copenhagen’s example on the use of temporary special measures to recruit more female professors

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review its position on the use of temporary special measures in order to accelerate the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in all areas

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: the strategy on women in management positions in the labour market and business sector include effective monitoring and accountability mechanisms, including sanctions for non-compliance with voluntary commitments taken by employers and other relevant groups

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourages the State party to take further legislative measures (to increase women in management positions and the labour market and business sector) as required

womensrightsissue: Equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: the Governments of the Faroe Islands and Greenland to provide full statistical data on women in management positions in elected and appointed bodies and as high-ranking officials within executive bodies, including in the judiciary, in their respective territories in the next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proactive concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: narrow and close the wage gap between women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider extending the equal pay monitoring and reporting obligations to companies with fewer than 35 employees

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensuring that job evaluation systems based on gender-sensitive criteria be developed with the aim of closing the existing wage gap between women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Governments of the Faroe Islands and Greenland to conduct surveys in order to gain a better understanding of the persistence of occupational segregation and the pay gap between women and men and to monitor trends, including through the collection and analysis of data disaggregated by sex, skills and sectors in part-time versus full-time work, as well as the impact of measures taken and results achieved, and to take the necessary corrective steps

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue their efforts to ensure reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and the promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by increasing incentives for men to take up their right to parental leave and to give women priority for available full-time employment positions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: draw on other Nordic countries’ good practices regarding the introduction of gender-based persecution as a ground for refugee status determination

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: give greater attention to the recovery and reintegration of all victims of trafficking, regardless of the victim’s cooperation in investigations

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue working closely with countries of origin to ensure safe repatriation of victims and their access to adequate care and rehabilitation and to pursue its bilateral, regional and international cooperation so as to further curb this phenomenon

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop guidelines on the handling of claims of gender-related persecution within Danish asylum law and practice so as to develop a more thorough way of identifying victims of trafficking and gender-based persecution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen measures aimed at addressing the exploitation of prostitution in the country and, in particular, the demand for prostitution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: address the factors driving women and girls into prostitution and strengthen the services put in place for their rehabilitation and reintegration into society

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review of the 24-year-old age limit in order to bring it into line with the rules applying to Danish couples. Furthermore, in view of the positive results of the awareness-raising campaign, the Committee encourages the State party to continue exploring alternative ways of combating forced marriages

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Enact legislation providing for the collection of data, disaggregated by age, ethnicity, nationality and relationship between the victim and the perpetrator, on all forms of violence against women and establish a mechanism with a clear mandate as well as adequate human, technical and financial resources for the analysis of such data

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen the quality and accessibility of protection measures, including restraining orders, for women who are victims of violence in Greenland and the Faroe Islands

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a legislative framework that explicitly provides for the protection of women from psychological violence, in line with the Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence, to which Denmark is a party

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to ensure that non-custodial accommodation is provided, with full access to appropriate medical and psychological support, for potential victims of trafficking while identification processes are carried out

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to strengthen its efforts to prevent trafficking aimed at international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination through the exchange of information and to harmonize legal procedures aiming at prosecution of traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider measures to discourage the demand for prostitution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its measures to prosecute and punish traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen the assistance provided to victims of trafficking who have been subjected to forced prostitution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that individuals who have purchased sex from victims of trafficking are prosecuted

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourages the State party to further strengthen its measures to support women, especially non-nationals, who wish to leave prostitution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: analyse the factors leading to the involvement of non-national women in prostitution with a view to applying the analysis to strengthen measures to address specific vulnerabilities to trafficking and exploitation of prostitution

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and private life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures, including temporary special measures such as statutory quotas or incentives for political parties to include an equal number of women and men in their electoral lists, especially at the municipal level and in Greenland and the Faroe Islands, to accelerate the equal representation of women in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and private life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: pay particular attention to the representation of women in legislative and executive bodies at the municipal level and in Greenland and the Faroe Islands, including in decision-making positions

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and private life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: closely monitor the implementation of the parliamentary bill on the promotion of gender balance on the boards of private and public companies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify its efforts aimed at diversifying academic and vocational choices for women and men and girls and boys, and take further measures to encourage women and men to choose non-traditional fields of education and career paths, such as science and technology for women and caregiving roles for men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage and facilitate academic careers by women, including through special temporary measures, in particular at the professorial level

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider promoting the establishment of comprehensive master’s and doctoral programmes in gender studies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to reduce the gender pay gap with a view to eliminating it, including by improving its data collection system to provide regular and independently verifiable data on gender and wages that are cross-comparable, and analyse the data collected as a basis for assessing progress achieved in the realization of gender equality in pay and for designing policies and programmes to eliminate gender-based wage differences

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide clear guidance on the concept of equal pay for work of equal value;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide effective mechanisms for seeking redress and compensation for violations of the principle of equal pay for work of equal value

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take proactive measures to eliminate occupational segregation, including by facilitating the provision of options for making a transition from part-time employment to full-time employment and creating more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide for adequate and clearly defined sanctions for companies that fail to meet targets for equal gender representation and provide specific mechanisms for the prompt enforcement of such sanctions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider strengthening the legal protection of women in cases of discrimination in the workplace relating to pregnancy and childbirth

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to increase the participation of women in the labour market arising out of public procurement, including by establishing obligations for public authorities to promote gender equality in the allocation of public procurement contracts

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and Violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to explore alternatives to the minimum age requirement as a means of combating forced marriage

documenttype: Communication No. 53/2013
recommendation: take all measures necessary to ensure that victims of gender-related forms of persecution who are in need of protection, regardless of their status or residence, are not returned under any circumstance to any country in which their life would be at risk or where they might be subjected to gender-based violence, or to torture or ill-treatment

womensrightsissue: Violence against women for asylum seekers
documenttype: Communication No. 53/2013
recommendation: adopt gender-sensitive procedural safeguards in asylum procedures to ensure that women asylum seekers are able to present their case on the basis of equality and non-discrimination

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and Violence against women
documenttype: Communication No. 46/2012
recommendation: Design specialized and mandatory training programmes for judges, prosecutors and lawyers as well as other professionals involved in administrative and judicial proceedings on the dynamics of violence against women, custody and visitation rights and the “best interests of the child” principle, non-discrimination against foreign nationals as well as gender stereotypes in order to equip them with the necessary knowledge and skills to discharge their duties in conformity with the State party’s international obligations

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage diversification of the educational choices of boys and girls

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop and implement programmes aimed at counselling women and girls on educational choices, bearing in mind their subsequent opportunities and chances in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt policies to increase the number of women professors among academic staff

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: speedily adopt and implement the draft national action plan on domestic violence, make it widely known to public officials and society at large, and monitor its effectiveness

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all women who are victims of domestic violence, including rural women, have access to immediate means of redress and protection, including protection orders and access to a sufficient number of safe and adequately funded shelters and to legal aid

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: elaborate a specific law on domestic violence against women which provides for such redress and protection

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: work towards a comprehensive approach to preventing and addressing all forms of violence against women, including a legislative framework

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: improve research and data collection on the prevalence, causes and consequences of violence against women. The state party should include in such data collection the relationship between the perpetrator and the victim

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the effective implementation of all measures taken to combat human trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect and analyse data from the police and international sources, prosecute and punish traffickers,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the protection of the human rights of trafficked women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: address the root cause of trafficking by increasing its efforts to improve the economic situation of women, thereby eliminating their vulnerability to exploitation and traffickers, and take measures for the rehabilitation and social integration of women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide, in its next report, comprehensive information and data on trafficking in women and girls, on the exploitation of prostitution and on the measures taken to prevent and combat such activities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take temporary special measures as provided for in the Gender Equality Act, to accelerate women’s full and equal participation in elected and appointed bodies. Such measures should include the establishment of benchmarks, numerical goals and timetables, as well as training programmes on leadership and negotiation skills ofr current and fufute women leaders.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: urges the State party to undertake awareness-raising campaigns about the importance of women’s participation in public and political life and at decision-making levels

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen efforts to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and to adopt measures to decrease and narrow the wage gap between women and men by applying job evaluation schemes in the public sector connected with wage increases in sectors dominated by women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen efforts to ensure women’s access to vocational training

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the effective implementation of the Wages Act, including provisions on equal pay for work of equal value

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide in its next report detailed information, including statistical data indicating trends over time, about the situation of women in the fields of employment and work in urban and rural areas and in the public, private, formal and informal sectors and about the impact of measures taken to realize equal opportunities for women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: raise the legal age of marriage for women and men to 18 years, in line with article 16, paragraph 2, of the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women, the Committee’s general recommendation 21 and the Convention on the Rights of the Child

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to prevent and address all forms of violence against women and girls, including domestic violence, in accordance with the Committee’s General Recommendation 19 and the State party’s reaffirmed commitment during the Universal Periodic Review of the Human Rights Council (A/HRC/WG.6/1/FIN/4, paragraph 50)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place expeditiously a comprehensive strategy or action plan and a campaign to prevent and eliminate all forms of violence against women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place expeditiously an effective institutional mechanism at the Cabinet level to coordinate, monitor and assess the effectiveness of measures taken

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: carry out studies and monitor closely the new law on the mediation procedure in order to ensure that such procedure is implemented in a way that respects and promotes women’s human rights and does not lead to perpetrators escaping prosecution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that a sufficient number of shelters are available to women victims of violence, staffed by expert personnel, provided with adequate financial resources and ensure shelters adhere to a strict policy of confidentiality to protect victim’s identity and the locality of shelters

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide complete information and data as well as the result of an on-going study on the exploitation of prostitution of women in its next periodic report, including clandestine prostitution in massage parlors, and an assessment of the law’s implementation to date

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue formulating strategies and programmes to prevent women from entering prostitution and establish programmes of rehabilitation and support for women and girls who wish to discontinue their lives in prostitution, including information on and support in relation to alternative livelihood options

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enhance cooperation among entities responsible for the monitoring of plans of actions against trafficking, including coordination with countries of origin and transit

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its efforts to encourage an increase in the number of women in high-ranking posts, particularly in academia and in the private sector

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adoption of proactive measures to encourage more women to apply for high-ranking posts, and encourage the state party to employ and effectively implement temporary special measures in accrodance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention, and with the Committee's general recommendation No. 25, in order to accelerate the realization of women's de facto equality with men in all areas.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the representation of women in political and public bodies reflects the full diversity of the population and includes migrant and minority women

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide data and information on the representation of women, including migrant and minority women, in political and public life, in academia and in diplomatic service, in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake a comprehensive curricula review and to introduce gender-sensitive curricula and teaching methods that address the structural and cultural causes of discrimination against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: gender issues and sensitivity training be made an integral and substantive component of all teachers’ training

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prioritize the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in the labour market, so as to achieve full compliance with article 11 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take concrete measures, including temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, to eliminate both vertical and horizontal occupational segregation and close the gender-based wage gap between women and men,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take concrete measures, including temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25,  to prevent the practice of illegal dismissal of women in cases of pregnancy and childbirth

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to ensure reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and to promote equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by developing incentives to encourage more men to avail themselves of parental leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: be proactive in its measures to prevent discrimination against Roma women, both within their communities and in society at large, to combat violence against them

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase their (Roma women) awareness of the availability of social services and legal remedies as well as to familiarize them with their rights to equality and non-discrimination

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop measures to eliminate all forms of discrimination and violence against Sami women, including engaging proactively with the Sami community and drawing up plans to increase women’s representation in both their communities and in Finnish society at large

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to eliminate discrimination against women with disabilities, to combat violence against them and to recognize them as a particular group with particular needs

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake efforts to eliminate female genital mutilation, including by raising awareness of its harmful effects for girls and women in the communities known to engage in this practice

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake efforts to eliminate female genital mutilation, including by incorporating an explicit provision criminalizing female genital mutilation into its legislation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: allocate adequate financial resources to the national action plan and strategies aimed at eliminating violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: establish an effective and adequately funded institutional mechanism at the government level to coordinate, monitor and assess the effectiveness of measures taken to eliminate violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take specific measures to promote the use of gender-sensitive language in public discourse on the issue of domestic violence and provide information on its gendered nature

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take the legislative and other measures necessary to prohibit mandatory mediation and conciliation in cases of intimate partner and other forms of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review the legislation on rape so as to remove any requirement that sexual assault be committed by force or threat and place the lack of consent at the centre of its definition;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: amend the Penal Code, chapter 20, section 1.2, on rape and section 5.1, containing provisions on sexual abuse, to ensure that the definition of rape also covers cases of non-consensual sexual acts where there is an abuse of authority, such as in cases of rape committed against women who are residents in closed institutions, and align the sanctions for such acts from a fine to the minimum sentence of imprisonment as is the case for the commission of such acts;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take specific measures to fully investigate, prosecute and punish perpetrators of rape in order to increase the conviction rates in cases of rape

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that a sufficient number of shelters, staffed by qualified personnel and provided with adequate financial resources, are available to women victims of violence, including those from disadvantaged groups who require special support

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: open rape crisis centres, walk-in centres and 24-hour, free-of-charge helplines that provide protection and assistance to all women victims of violence, including migrant women, women with disabilities and women belonging to sexual minorities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ratify the Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence within the time frame indicated by the State party

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review its legislation on human trafficking and provide clear definitions of trafficking and pandering to ensure that victims are properly identified and provided with adequate protection and assistance

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Assess the risk of deportation for victims of trafficking under the Aliens Act and introduce amendments to the Act where necessary

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that women and girls who are victims of trafficking have access to medical care, legal and psychosocial counselling, adequate housing, education, income-generating opportunities and rehabilitation and reintegration programmes, regardless of their ability or willingness to testify against traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Pursue steps to criminalize the demand for prostitution and take measures to discourage such demand

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect disaggregated data on women engaged in prostitution, with a view to formulating strategies and programmes to prevent women from entering prostitution and to assist women and girls who wish to leave prostitution, including through alternative income-generating opportunities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt temporary special measures to ensure that the representation of women in leadership positions in the private sector reflects the full diversity of the population

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt temporary special measures to ensure the representation of women from disadvantaged groups, such as women with disabilities, women from ethnic minorities, Roma women and migrant women in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider amending legislation to enable the collection of statistical data needed for programmes and policies aimed at overcoming discrimination against women belonging to the groups mentioned above

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide disaggregated information on the representation of women in political and public life in its next periodic report, including on the women belonging to the groups mentioned above

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: eliminate gender stereotypes and structural barriers that potentially deter girls’ and boys’ enrolment in non-traditional educational and occupational fields at all levels of the education system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider adopting temporary special measures to accelerate the appointment of women in academic institutions, through women-specific grants and other affirmative action measures, such as setting clear targets and time frames for promoting the recruitment of women as full-time professors

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take immediate measures to meet the target set by the Equal Pay Programme of a gender-based wage gap of 15 per cent by 2015, with a view to closing the wage gap between men and women in accordance with the Equal Remuneration Convention, 1951 (No. 100) of the International Labour Organization

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt temporary special measures to accelerate the equal participation of women from disadvantaged groups, including migrant women, Roma women, single mothers, older women and women with disabilities in the labour market,

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake comprehensive studies on the employment and working conditions of those groups of women, with recommendations for enhancing their effective participation in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend legislation to specifically prohibit employers from not renewing fixed-term employment contracts based on family leave and from limiting their duration on that basis

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue efforts to ensure the reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and promote the equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by developing incentives to encourage more men to avail themselves of parental leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take immediate steps to repeal section 2 of the Sterilization Act, which permits the sterilization of women with disabilities who have limited legal capacity or who have been deprived of their legal capacity without their consent

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take specific measures to address violence against women with disabilities through the provision of accessible shelters and 24-hour victim support hotlines

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take specific measures to address violence against women with disabilities through police training and awareness-raising regarding such violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt proactive measures to prevent discrimination against Roma women, both in their communities and in society at large, combat violence against them and increase their access to social services and legal remedies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt proactive measures to prevent discrimination against Roma women, both in their communities and in society at large, combat violence against them and educate Roma women and girls about their rights to equality and non‑discrimination

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect data on access by Roma women to education, employment, health care and shelters for Roma victims of violence, on the impact of the measures taken to enhance such access and on the results achieved

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for Sami women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt specific measures with the aim of increasing the representation of Sami women in the political and public life of both their community and the State party’s society at large

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that Sami women who are victims of domestic violence have access to shelters and services that address their needs

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt measures to ensure that domestic violence is a factor to be systematically considered in child custody decisions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its work of finding the most appropriate way to pursue measures to encourage girls to study non-traditional subjects and companies to recruit women for non‑stereotypical posts

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen measures to accelerate women’s full and equal participation in all aspects of political and public life and in decision-making bodies, especially in high-ranking posts, including in academia, as mayors and as judges

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take appropriate measures to implement the Act on Parity in the Political Sphere and other relevant legislation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to ensure de facto equality for women in the labour market, so as to achieve full compliance with article 11 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proactive and concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and narrow and close the pay gap between women and men. In that regard, the Committee recommends that the State party implement its plan of curbing wage gaps, including through financial sanctions as of 2010 for companies that do not have a plan to redress wage inequalities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: create more opportunities for women to have access to full-time employment. The Committee recommends that the State party continue its efforts to allow women and men to reconcile family and professional responsibilities and for the promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between men and women by providing, inter alia, more and improved childcare facilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage men to share responsibility for childcare, including through awareness-raising activities and by taking parental leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement the President’s expressed desire to increase the minimum old-age pension, improve the retirement pensions for people in agriculture and crafts and provide retirement pensions for homemakers who had not worked professionally

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake special measures to assist women with disabilities to enter into the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take comprehensive measures in order to address all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: analyse all cases of violence against women, particularly those that result in murders of women, and ensure the adoption of effective measures to prevent violence against women and protect them from violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen the cooperation between police, the public prosecutor and non-governmental organizations in the prevention of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect comprehensive statistical data disaggregated by age and type of violence and the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures to suppress all forms of trafficking and exploitation of prostitution of women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: systematically collect and analyse data, disaggregated by age and social origin, to improve insight into situations of trafficking and related trends and in order to identify the root causes of the phenomenon, and to formulate and implement policies to address such root causes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review the obligation of submitting a complaint to be granted residence permits in order to ensure that trafficked women and girls need of international protection are not expelled

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake a comprehensive study on the impact of the Act of 18 March 2003 on internal security, including the prohibition of passive soliciting, on the area of prostitution and to review the definition of sexual harassment

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in health for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that sex education, including prevention of early pregnancy, be widely promoted and targeted at both girls and boys, women and men, with special attention being paid to migrant and immigrant girls and boys and women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: study the scale and consequences of child marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take urgent measures to prevent such marriage among all ethnic groups by taking comprehensive information and awareness-raising measures targeting the public, parents and religious and traditional leaders about the harmful impact of the practice on girls, in particular on their health and development potential

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to prevent the growing number of murders of women by their husbands and partners and other forms of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage women to report acts of sexual and domestic violence by raising awareness about the criminal nature of such acts

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the effective investigation of cases of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prosecute and punish perpetrators with sanctions commensurate with the gravity of the crime and to provide victims with adequate compensation for damages suffered

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all women who are victims of violence have access to effective protection and assistance, including State-funded shelters, and to improve cooperation with relevant non-governmental organizations in this respect

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prohibit and adequately sanction the practice of virginity tests carried out on women in violation of their right to privacy

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that all reports of trafficking in women and girls are promptly and effectively investigated and perpetrators prosecuted and adequately punished

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Establish effective permanent mechanisms to identify victims of trafficking, especially among foreign women in prostitution, and allocate sufficient resources to rehabilitation and reintegration programmes for such victims, in addition to ensuring that victims have access to witness protection programmes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide financial and other forms of support to civil society organizations working with women who are victims of trafficking in order to facilitate their rehabilitation and reintegration

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Combat impunity of perpetrators by investigating reported cases of corruption and ensuring that perpetrators of trafficking-related crimes are punished under the articles of the Criminal Code that match the seriousness of the offence of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that, during raids of brothels and individual establishments, victims of trafficking and forced prostitution are not treated as offenders

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for ethnic minorities, violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promote school attendance by girls belonging to ethnic minorities, in particular at the secondary level, and take measures to remove barriers to their access to education, such as child marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Abolish the requirement for Georgian citizenship or identity documents for gaining access to education beyond the ninth grade

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to ensure gender balance among teaching professionals, both at the level of teachers and within the senior levels of school administration, by providing the necessary incentives, including career mobility

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
