recommendation: Take measures to increase the participation of women in employment and effectively address the concentration of women in low-paid jobs

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt measures to implement the principle of equal pay for work of equal value in order to narrow and close the gender wage gap, consistently reviewing the wages of men and women in all sectors

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Facilitate the reconciliation of professional and private life for women and men, including by expanding the number of childcare facilities and encouraging men to equally participate in family responsibilities,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ratify the Maternity Protection Convention, 2000 (No. 183), of the International Labour Organization;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen measures to prevent and combat sexual harassment of women in the workplace by establishing labour inspectorates for effective labour law reporting and enforcement mechanisms

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Taking measures to eliminate the practice of sex-selective abortions resulting from prenatal sex discernment

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that rural women have adequate access to social, health-care and other basic services and economic opportunities, in addition to equal opportunities to participate in political and public life, in particular in decisions relating to the agricultural sector

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the availability of nurseries, in addition to shelters and other services for victims of domestic violence, in rural areas

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to address violence against and harassment of lesbian, bisexual and transsexual women and to abolish restrictions for transgender persons with regard to obtaining identity documents

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: amend the Civil Code to allow marriages between 16 and 18 years of age only by judicial authorization in exceptional circumstances and to ensure that such court decisions are made only upon expressed consent by a child in person before the court so that this does not result in forced marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prevent the practice of unregistered marriage and, if such marriages occur, to ensure that they are not used to sexually abuse girls below 16 years of age

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all legislative measures necessary to safeguard the economic rights of women in such marriages

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: provide adequate financial compensation to the authors commensurate with the gravity of the violations of their rights
missingmaterial: Unable to locate in the jurisprudence documentation

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: Ensure that victims of domestic violence and their children are provided with prompt and adequate support, including shelter and psychological support

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: Intensify awareness-raising campaigns and introduce a zero-tolerance policy in respect of violence against women and, more specifically, domestic violence

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: Ratify the Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: Provide mandatory training for judges, lawyers and law enforcement personnel, including prosecutors, on the application of the Prevention of Domestic Violence Act, including on the definition of domestic violence and on gender stereotypes, as well as appropriate training on the Convention, the Optional Protocol thereto and the Committee’s general recommendations, in particular general recommendation No. 19
missingmaterial: Unable to locate in the jurisprudence documentation

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: give due consideration to the views of the Committee, together with its recommendations, and shall submit to the Committee, within six months, a written response, including information on any action taken in the light of the views and recommendations of the Committee
missingmaterial: Unable to locate in the jurisprudence documentation

documenttype: Communication No. 24/2009
recommendation: publish recommendations and to have them widely disseminated, in order to reach all sectors of society.
missingmaterial: Unable to locate in the jurisprudence documentation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up its efforts to assist women and men in striking a balance between family and employment responsibilities, inter alia through further awareness-raising and education initiatives for both women and men on adequate sharing of care of children and domestic tasks, as well as by ensuring that part-time employment is not taken up almost exclusively by women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up its efforts to improve the availability, affordability and quality of care places for school-age children in order to facilitate the re-entry of women into the labour market

womensrightsissue: Gender equalitly in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adoption of proactive measures to encourage more women to apply for high-ranking posts, particularly in academia, and encourages the State party to adopt temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, in order to accelerate the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in all areas

womensrightsissue: Gender equalitly in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its gender-equality legislation provisions to mandate the use of temporary special measures, including goals or quotas, enhanced by a system of incentives, in both the public and private sectors

womensrightsissue: Gender equalitly in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor developments with regard to the participation of women in top management positions, with a view to further supporting such participation through legislative or policy initiatives

womensrightsissue: Gender equalitly in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the representation of women in political and public bodies reflects the full diversity of the population

womensrightsissue: Gender equalitly in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the representation of women in political and public bodies reflects the full diversity of the population and provide information on results achieved, including relevant disaggregated statistical data

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its programme aimed at diversifying academic and vocational choices for girls and boys and to take further measures to encourage girls to choose non-traditional fields of education

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for refugee and asylum-seeking girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the situation of refugee and asylum-seeking girls, especially undocumented ones, at all educational levels and to continue to address the difficulties they experience in the school system.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: amend the General Equal Treatment Act in order for it to fully comply with the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt policies and to take all necessary measures, including temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and general recommendation No. 25 with time-bound targets, to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: assess the impact on women of the Fourth Law for Modern Services in the Labour Market and to undertake corrective measures, including the review of the “needs unit” construct

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: mainstream the issues of immigrant women, who may suffer multiple discrimination, and women with disabilities into its employment policies and programmes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to ensure reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and for the promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by increasing the incentives for men to use their right to parental leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: examine ways to review the current pension system so as to increase the percentage of women eligible for full benefits

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include, in its next periodic report, information on the extent of use and impact of temporary special measures in the private sector and on measures taken to improve the situation of women in the labour market and the impact of those measures

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to take proactive concrete measures to narrow and close the wage gap between women and men. In particular, the Committee calls upon the State party to ensure that non-discriminatory job evaluations and job assignment systems are put in place and implemented

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider enacting an equality act for the private sector, with the establishment of a gender-based definition of pay in wage agreements and company pay structures, or amending the General Equal Treatment Act to that effect.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that comprehensive measures are in place to address all forms of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to ensure the effective implementation of the 2007 action plan on violence and to continue implementing policies to prevent such violence, provide protection, support and services to the victims, and punish and rehabilitate offenders

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to study and analyse all types of violence against women particularly those that result in murders of women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement legislation requiring that convictions for acts of domestic violence be taken into account in child custody or visitation decisions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take the necessary measures to ensure greater cooperation between the Federal Government, the Länder and the municipalities to monitor the provision of social services with a view to ensuring the availability of a sufficient number of shelters equipped to accommodate women with special needs, such as women with disabilities, throughout the territory of the State party and making sure that such shelters are adequately financed and open for all, regardless of the victim’s financial resources

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: establish a method of collecting comprehensive statistical data disaggregated by sex, age, type of violence and the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide statistical information in its next periodic report on the number of cases of female genital mutilation on women and girls living in Germany

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures to suppress all forms of trafficking in women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide in its next report comprehensive information and data about all forms of trafficking in women and girls, as well as information on the impact of measures taken and results achieved

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide information on the measures taken to follow up on the results of the evaluation of the Prostitution Act and to provide data on the exploitation of women and on prostitution, including clandestine prostitution, in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue formulating strategies and programmes to prevent women from entering prostitution and to establish programmes of rehabilitation and support for women and girls who wish to leave prostitution, including by providing information on, and support in relation to, alternative livelihood options

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures to ensure that complaints lodged against its troops abroad are resolved expeditiously, in order to avoid any possible inference of impunity

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide awareness-raising training for military forces and civilian police personnel on forced prostitution and to establish a strict code of conduct, together with a strict monitoring system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: envisage launching a national action plan to implement Security Council resolution 1325 (2000)

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in health and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the presence of a proportionate percentage of women in decision-making positions in order to better take into account women’s needs and perspectives

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake research on the economic consequences of divorce on both spouses, with specific attention to the enhanced human capital and earning potential of male spouses on the basis of their full-time and uninterrupted career pattern

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: be proactive in its measures to prevent discrimination against such women (minority women), both within their communities and in society at large, to combat violence against them, and to increase their awareness of the availability of social services and legal remedies as well as familiarize them with their rights to gender equality and non-discrimination

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take effective measures to integrate them (disadvanted women) into the German labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: carry out studies and monitor closely the Law on Combating Domestic Violence, particularly its mediation procedure, in order to ensure that the legislation is implemented in a way that respects and promotes women’s human rights and does not lead to perpetrators escaping punishment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place training measures for judges who conduct mediation in criminal proceedings for domestic violence cases so as to enhance their capacity to deal with violence against women in a gender-sensitive manner

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively implement the integrated National Plan of Action against Trafficking in Human Beings

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to ensure that legislation on trafficking is fully enforced, in particular by effectively prosecuting and punishing offenders

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase its efforts to prevent human trafficking and provide assistance and support to women victims

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively enforce the existing quota law in order to increase women’s participation in local elected bodies and in the collective bodies of all Government agencies

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and its general recommendation 25 as a means to accelerate compliance with the provisions of articles 7 and 8 of the Convention and to increase women’s political participation in all areas, including in Parliament and the foreign service

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implementation of awareness-raising activities about the importance of women’s participation in decision-making for society as a whole

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take appropriate measures to ensure women’s equal participation in trade unions and employers’ associations in compliance with articles 2 (e) and 7 (c) of the Convention

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the impact of measures taken and of trends over time to ensure women's participation in local elected bodies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement measures to raise awareness of the importance of education as a human right and as a basis for empowerment of women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and general recommendation 25, on temporary special measures, in order to increase the representation of women, including minority women, in tertiary education

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: report on the measures taken (to raise awaraeness of education as a human right) and their impact in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market through, inter alia, temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and general recommendation 25, on temporary special measures

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: efforts be strengthened to lower female unemployment, eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and to narrow and close the wage gap between women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct regular reviews of its legislation in accordance with article 11, paragraph 3, of the Convention, with a view to reducing the number of barriers women face in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the use of the parental leave provisions by women and men as an indicator of shared family responsibilities and to develop incentives to encourage more men to avail themselves of parental leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the impact of measures taken and results achieved (on ensuring more equal opportunities in the labor market)  and to report thereon in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enforce laws prohibiting early marriages and polygamy and to take comprehensive measures aimed at eliminating these practices, in line with the Greek constitutional order, article 16 of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation 21 on equality in marriage and family relations

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensuring the strict enforcement of the national legislation on violence against women and ensuring that women and girls who are victims of violence have access to immediate means of redress and protection and further ensuring that perpetrators are prosecuted and punished

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Raising public awareness, through the media and educational programmes (violence against women)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: providing mandatory training for judges, prosecutors, police officers, health-service providers, journalists and teaching staff in order to ensure that they are sensitized to all forms of violence against women and girls and can provide adequate gender-sensitive support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Encouraging women to report incidents of domestic and sexual violence by de-stigmatizing victims and raising awareness about the criminal nature of such acts

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Providing adequate assistance and protection to women victims of violence by establishing shelters, especially in rural areas, and enhancing cooperation with non-governmental organizations providing shelter and rehabilitation to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collecting statistical data on all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence disaggregated by sex, age, ethnicity/minority status and relationship between victim and perpetrator, and undertaking studies and/or surveys on the extent of violence against women and its root causes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure effective implementation of the national anti-trafficking legislation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct studies and surveys including on the prevalence of prostitution and seek international assistance as required

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its next periodic report updated information and data on the prevalence of exploitation of prostitution and trafficking in women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase efforts aimed at international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination to prevent trafficking through information exchange and harmonizing legal procedures to prosecute traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address the root causes of trafficking and prostitution, including poverty, in order to reduce the vulnerability of women and girls to sexual exploitation and trafficking, and to ensure the rehabilitation and social integration of victims, including by providing them with shelter and assistance

womensrightsissue: Geender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider the use of temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendations No. 23 (1997) and No. 25 (2004)

womensrightsissue: Geender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: study the international examples of quota systems, analyse the best practices in other countries

womensrightsissue: Geender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: establish adequate quotas with the aim of accelerating the equal representation of women in all areas of public and professional life, especially in decision-making positions, in Parliament and in the local administration

womensrightsissue: Geender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Systematically implement the 30 per cent quota in the civil service boards and ensure that women enjoy equal opportunities to participate in political and public life, including in the planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development policies and local community projects

womensrightsissue: Geender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide training on gender equality for politicians, journalists, teachers, local officials and civil society leaders, especially men, to enhance the understanding that full, free and democratic participation of women on an equal basis with men in political and public life is a requirement for the full implementation of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address barriers to education of women and girls, such as stereotypical cultural attitudes that discriminate against them

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Step up efforts to provide girls with career counselling that orients them to non-traditional career paths, in particular in technical-vocational areas

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen efforts to enhance female access to the labour market, eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and adopt measures to narrow and close the wage gap between women and men and, make sure that female wages and pensions are not below the poverty limits

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Carefully review and analyse the impact of the new legislation on women’s opportunities in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: make necessary amendments to ensure women’s equal participation in the labour market, by instituting measures to eliminate stereotypes and traditional attitudes that discriminate against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Restore the institutions of social dialogue which provide important social services for women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect data disaggregated by sex, geographical location and minority, on the situation of women and men in the area of employment in order to monitor and improve women’s working conditions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen its enforcement efforts to prohibit polygamy and forced or early marriages, in line with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 21 (1994) on equality in marriage and family relations, by raising awareness about the detrimental effects of these practices including on girls’ health and completion of education

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen its enforcement efforts to prohibit polygamy and forced or early marriages, in line with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 21 (1994) on equality in marriage and family relations, by effectively investigate, prosecute and punish perpetrators of forced or early marriages

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage diversification of the educational choices of boys and girls. It urges the State party to develop and implement programmes aimed at counselling women and girls and men and boys on educational choices, bearing in mind their subsequent equal opportunities and chances in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement effectively, with specified time frames, the national strategy to prevent and effectively manage family violence and to monitor its impact

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all women who are victims of domestic violence, including rural women, have access to immediate means of redress and protection, including protection orders, and access to a sufficient number of safe shelters and legal aid

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: elaborate a specific law on domestic violence against women which provides for such redress and protection

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that public officials, especially law enforcement personnel, the judiciary, health-care providers and social workers, are fully familiar with applicable legal provisions and are sensitized to all forms of violence against women and respond adequately to them

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: work towards a comprehensive approach to preventing and addressing all forms of violence against women and to improve its research and data collection on the prevalence, causes and consequences of violence against women and to include the results of such research in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: reform its law to define sexual crimes as crimes involving violations of women’s rights to bodily security and integrity and that the State party define the crime of rape as sexual intercourse without consent

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: age of consent be raised and that the State party incorporate the concept of statutory rape and prohibit sexual intercourse with underage girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: raise the legal age of marriage for women and men to 18 years, in line with article 16, paragraph 2, of the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women, the Committee’s general recommendation 21 and the Convention on the Rights of the Child

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to ensure that the definition of trafficking in its legislation and related policies and plans is in line with article 3 (a) of the Protocol to Prevent, Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially Women and Children, supplementing the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accelerate the formulation of its national strategy to combat trafficking in human beings, to ensure the effective implementation, with specified time frames, of all measures taken to combat human trafficking and to ensure that an effective monitoring system is in place to track progress

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect and analyse data from the police and international sources (trafficking)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prosecute and punish traffickers, and ensure the protection of the human rights of trafficked women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: address the root cause of trafficking by increasing its efforts to improve the economic situation of women, thereby eliminating their vulnerability to exploitation and traffickers, and take measures for the rehabilitation and social integration of women and girls who are victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide, in next report, comprehensive information and data on trafficking in women and girls, on the exploitation of prostitution and on the measures taken to prevent and combat such activities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: speedily adopt and implement the proposal aimed at having a 50 per cent male/female quota for local and national list-based elections

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take other sustained measures, including temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendations 25 and 23, and as provided for in the Equal Treatment Act, to accelerate women’s full and equal participation in elected and appointed bodies in all sectors and at all levels (including the establishment of benchmarks, numerical goals and timetables, as well as training programmes on leadership and negotiation skills for current and future women leaders)

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt policies to increase the number of women professors among academic staff

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake awareness-raising campaigns about the importance of women’s participation in public and political life and at decision-making levels

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen efforts to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and to adopt measures to narrow and close the wage gap between women and men by applying job evaluation schemes in the public sector connected with wage increases in sectors dominated by women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen efforts to ensure women’s access to vocational training in all sectors

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the effective implementation of legislative provisions, including those in the Labour Code, on equal pay for work of equal value and on equal opportunities in employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide in its next report detailed information, including statistical data indicating trends over time, about the situation of women in the fields of employment and work in urban and rural areas and in the public, private, formal and informal sectors and about the impact of measures taken to realize equal opportunities for women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen measures allowing for the reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and that the sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men be promoted

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for Roma women

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a law on domestic violence and criminalize different types of violence against women, including economic and psychological violence and stalking

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend its legislation concerning restraining orders with a view to  providing  adequate  protection to victims in all types of cohabitation and extend the duration of restraining orders

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

recommendation: Ratify as soon as possible the Council of Europe Convention on preventing and combating violence against women and domestic violence

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

recommendation: Ensure that children in prostitution are not treated as offenders but as victims

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

Special attention should be given to articles 45 and 112 of the Code of Criminal Procedure No. 19/1991 with regard to the broad competence of the Director of Public prosecution)

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined fifth and sixth periodic report

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports

recommendation: Take measures, including temporary special measures, to increase the participation  of  women  in  political  and  public  life,  especially  in  le gislative  and executive bodies at the  municipal level, such as financial incentives for political parties to include an equal number of women and men in their electoral lists or a zipper system for the appointment of women and men to public offices

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider  establishing  mandatory,  age-appropriate  women’s  human rights education, including sexual and reproductive rights, at the primary and secondary levels

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify its efforts to diversify academic and vocational choices for women  and  girls  and  men  and  boys,  and  take  further  measures  to  encourage women and men to choose non-traditional fields of education and career paths

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Further  promote  and  facilitate  the  upward  mobility  of  women  in academic careers, including through special temporary measures

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review the history books used at school to ensure that the historical roles and contributions of women are adequately reflected

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take  measures  to  make  sports  education  more  attractive  and culturally  appropriate  for  girls  and  promote  the  participation  of  women  and girls in sports clubs

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for migrant women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide  information  on  access  by  migrant  girls  to  primary  and secondary  education  and  take  measures  to  support  their  integration  into  the school system, including by providing language classes, if needed

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take  measures  to  protect  women  police  officers  from  sexual harassment at work

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take  measures  to  reduce  the  gap  between  the  end  of  parental  leave and  the  minimum  age  of  eligibility  for  guaranteed  childcare  by  extending parental  leave  from  9  to  12  months,  accepting  children  into  play  schools directly  after  the  end  of  parental  leave  and  providing  adequate  human  and financial  resources  to  municipalities  to  enable  them  to  meet  the  demand  for places in play schools

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide adequate funding for the Parental Leave Fund and raise the amount of maximum disbursements from the Fund

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt targeted measures to facilitate access by single mothers to the labour market and support them in having a better balance between family and working life

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review its regulations on government  funding  bodies  for  culture  and  explore  options  to  ensure  that public funds for culture are divided equally between women and men

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in family and economy
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct research on the economic  consequences  of  divorce  on  both  spouses,  taking  into  account  the length  of  the  marriage  and  the  number  of  children

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in family and economy
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt  such  legal measures as may be necessary to redress economic disparities between men and women  upon  the  dissolution  of  marriage,  including,  in  particular,  recognizing all career-related assets (i.e. earning  potential, personal goodwill and enhanced human  capital)  as  part  of  the  marital  assets  to  be  distributed  between  the spouses  upon  divorce  or  taken  into  account  in  the  award  of  post -divorce periodic payments

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in family and economy
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt the  legal  measures  necessary  to  prevent  the  concealment  of  matrimonial property

reportconsidered: combined seventh and eighth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in family and economy
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt  the  legal  measures necessary  to  guarantee  that  women  living  in  de  facto  relationships  have economic  protection,  by  recognizing  their  rights  to  the  property  accumulated during  the  relationship,  in  line  with  its  general  recommendation  No.  29  on article  16  of  the  Convention  (economic  consequences  of  marriage,  family relations and their dissolution)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take into account the fact that long-term and definitive measures alone could be insufficient to comply with the State party’s general obligation to fulfill women’s right to non-discrimination and to the enjoyment of equality with men and that temporary special measures are “appropriate means” for achievement of gender equality, in particular in employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Apply temporary special measures in various forms in areas where women are underrepresented, such as legislative, executive, administrative and political bodies, or disadvantaged, in particular with the aim to further improve the situation of rural, migrant,older, Roma and Sinti women, and women with disabilities, and allocate additional resources where needed to accelerate thier advancement

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Mainstream gender equality and eliminate patriarchal stereotypes in the education system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Make gender equality issues and sensitivity training an integral, substantive and mandatory component of all teachers’ training, at all levels

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Put emphasis on comprehensive measures to address violence against women in the family and in society, including through addressing the specific needs of women made vulnerable by particular circumstances, such as Roma and Sinti, migrant and older women and women with disabilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that female victims of violence have immediate protection, including expulsion of the perpetrator from the home, a guarantee that they can stay in secure and well-funded shelters, in all parts of the country, and that they have access to free legal aid, psychosocial counselling and adequate redress, including compensation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that public officials, especially law enforcement officials and professionals in the judiciary, health care, social work and education are systematically and fully sensitized to all forms of violence against women and girls

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in disadvantaged groups
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Enhance the system of appropriate data collection on all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence, protection measures, prosecutions and sentences imposed on perpetrators, and conduct appropriate surveys to assess the prevalence of violence experienced by women belonging to disadvantaged groups, such as Roma and Sinti, migrant and older women and women with disabilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: pursue, in collaboration with a broad range of stakeholders, including women’s and other civil society organizations, awareness-raising campaigns through the media and public education programmes to make violence against women socially unacceptable, and disseminate information on available measures to prevent acts of violence against women among the general public

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ratify the Council of Europe Convention on preventing and combating violence against women and domestic violence, in a timely manner

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take into account the transnational dimension of the crime of human trafficking, as acknowledged in the Protocol to Prevent, Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially Women and Children, supplementing the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime, and standardize identification and referral procedures for potential victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite the process of adopting the national action plan against trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that interpretation of article 18 of Legislative Decree No. 286/1998 does not deprive women who were trafficked in another country of adequate protection

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Undertake an impact assessment of the proposed measures criminalizing street prostitution with the aim of identifying potential risks for the exploitation of women who may move from outdoor prostitution circuits to indoor prostitution, where, as recognized by the State party, prostitution remains a hidden and unknown phenomenon

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue formulating strategies and programmes to prevent women from entering prostitution and to establish programmes of support and rehabilitation for women who wish to leave prostitution, including by providing information on, and support in relation to, alternative livelihood options

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify its efforts to strengthen women’s representation in leadership roles and in decision-making positions in political bodies, including Parliament and regional councils, in the public administration, including in the diplomatic service, and in the private sector, and to that end, take adequate temporary special measures

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take additional measures to accelerate the achievement of women’s full and equal participation in decision-making at all levels and in all areas

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider taking additional legislative measures under article 51 of the Constitution to increase the number of women in political and public positions, including through the use of gender quotas,

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure adequate representation, in such positions [political and public positions], of Roma and migrant women, and women from the south of the country

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Implement measures to decrease dropout rates among Roma and Sinti girls and to reintegrate them into the educational system

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide information, in its next report, on concrete projects directed at the education of Roma girls and women, under the Decade of Roma Inclusion 2005‑2015

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to take concrete measures to ensure de facto equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market, including through temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take concrete and proactive measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, including through education, training and retraining and effective law enforcement mechanisms

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Develop and apply job evaluation systems based on gender-sensitive criteria and collect sex-disaggregated data regarding the type and extent of wage differentials, in order to eliminate the practice of women receiving unequal pay for work of equal value

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Monitor the impact of the use of fixed-term and other flexible contracts and increase incentives for employers, when appropriate, to counteract possible adverse consequences of such contracts for women, especially in regard to their job security, salary levels and pension and retirement benefits

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Enhance its efforts to ensure reconciliation of family, private and professional responsibilities and for the promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by increasing the incentives for men to use their right to parental leave and taking concerted efforts to provide for additional childcare facilities for children of different age groups, in particular in regions with few childcare facilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate steps to abolish the practice of so-called “resignation in blank” (undated letters of resignation by pregnant female employees)

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: mainstream the issues of immigrant women and women with disabilities, who may suffer multiple forms of discrimination, into its employment policies and programmes,

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts, including with the adoption of temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, aimed at achieving de facto equal opportunities for immigrant women and women with disabilities in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Reduce the length of divorce proceedings to one year, as currently under debate within the Chambers

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue protecting and enhancing the rights, in particular economic rights, of women living in de facto unions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify its efforts to eliminate discrimination against Roma, Sinti, immigrant, refugee, asylum-seeking and older women, with respect to accessing education, health and employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect statistics on early marriages among Roma and Sinti girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to prevent discrimination against women belonging to disadvantaged groups, both within their communities and in society at large, to combat violence against them and to increase their awareness of the availability of social services and legal remedies, as well as familiarize them with their right to gender equality and non-discrimination

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the full implementation of legislation prohibiting female genital mutilation, including the prosecution of perpetrators, with a view to eliminating this harmful practice

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct regular and comprehensive studies on discrimination against immigrant, refugee, asylum-seeking and older women, to collect statistics on their employment, education, health situation and on all forms of violence that they may experience, and to submit such information in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market, in both the public and private sectors

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proactive measures to eliminate occupational segregation, such as the provision of enhanced educational and training opportunities for women, and continue to expand measures to facilitate women’s re-entry into the workforce after childbirth

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enforce and monitor the application of existing measures on equal pay for equal work and work of equal value, flexible work arrangements and part-time work in the public and private sectors and develop, as necessary, measures to counteract any possible adverse consequences of part-time work for women, especially in regard to their pension and retirement benefits

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that measures to facilitate the reconciliation of family and work responsibilities be targeted at both women and men and to work towards greater involvement of men in domestic and care responsibilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt measures that encourage fathers to make greater use of parental leave and consider creating financial incentives towards that end.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to strengthen women’s representation in leadership roles and in decision-making positions in political bodies, including Parliament, municipal councils, commissions and advisory councils, in public administration, including the diplomatic service, and in the private sector

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expand its current awareness-raising efforts and training activities to a wider range of stakeholders, including leaders of political parties, senior managers in the private sector and boards of trustees of foundations under public law

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures, in particular temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation 25 on temporary special measures and general recommendation 23 on women in public life, so as to accelerate the achievement of women’s full and equal participation at all levels and in all areas

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the impact of measures taken and results achieved over time and to report thereon in its next periodic report (to accelerate the achievement of women’s full and equal participation at all levels and in all areas)

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: further assess the results achieved with currently applied temporary special measures and, accordingly, consider expanding these to a variety of strategies, including legislative and administrative measures, outreach and support programmes, the allocation of resources and the creation of incentives, targeted recruitment and the setting of time-bound goals and quotas, in different areas of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Organize awareness-raising campaigns to promote responsible fatherhood and to sensitize employers and employees on the topic of flexible work arrangements for women as well as men in order to ensure that part-time employment is not taken up almost exclusively by women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider introducing ex officio prosecution for all acts of domestic, sexual and other forms of gender-based violence deliberately depriving victims of protection from, or exposing them to, such violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: train judges, prosecutors and the police on the strict application of relevant criminal law provisions, strengthen the support and assistance available to victims of domestic and sexual violence, and expedite its efforts to adopt the National Action Plan on Violence against Women drafted in 2008

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that women from other countries who are alleged victims of spousal violence have access to legal aid and protection so as to enable them to prove their victims status in order to retain their residence permit upon dissolution of their marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Apply a standard procedure for identifying victims of sexual or gender-based violence when considering the admissibility of asylum applications on formal grounds or the return of applicants

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that international protection needs are determined comprehensively, including by recognizing refugee claims on the basis of sexual or gender-based violence and by taking into account the factual situation of asylum-seeking women and girls in their countries of origin

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure a gender-sensitive approach throughout the refugee status determination procedure by providing special rights such as counselling services for female asylum-seekers, in line with article 23, paragraph 6, of the State party’s Refugee Act.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that women and girls who have been trafficked or fear being trafficked upon return to their country of origin and whose claims to international protection fall within the refugee definition of the 1951 Convention relating to the Status of Refugees are recognized as refugees and granted asylum

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Establish mechanisms for the identification of victims of trafficking as well as referral mechanisms to ensure that asylum claims are assessed in an age and gender-sensitive procedure in order to respond to the specific protection needs of women and girls who are victims of trafficking and guarantee protection against refoulement

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Raise awareness among asylum-seekers and train police and immigration officers on the increased risk of asylum-seekers of becoming victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that temporary residence permits, protection and support are provided to all victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite its efforts to ratify the Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Rights of the Child on the sale of children, child prostitution and child pornography

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, such as statutory quota, a gender parity system for nominations for Government bodies, and conditioning the financing of political parties on equal representation of women in their internal bodies and on candidate lists, to increase the representation of women in decision-making positions in elected and appointed political bodies

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide training on gender equality to civil servants and politicians, especially men, with a view to enhancing the understanding that full and equal participation of women and men in political and public life is a requirement for the full implementation of the Convention, and thus creating a more favourable environment for women’s participation in political and public life

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify efforts aimed at diversifying academic and vocational choices for women and men and to take further measures to encourage women and men to choose gender-atypical fields of education and careers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promote the enrolment of women in Master and PhD programmes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Encourage applications by women for positions of professor, department chair, lecturer and docent, as well as for leading university management positions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Respect the principle of gender parity when appointing members to the university council

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Allocate adequate funding and resources for special gender and diversity programmes and funds at higher education institutions in the State party

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt policies and take all necessary measures, including temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, with time-bound targets and indicators to achieve substantive equality of men and women in the labour market, eliminate occupational segregation and close the gender wage gap

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Counteract any adverse consequences of part-time work for women, especially with regard to their career development options as well as pension and other social security benefits

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider adhering to the International Labour Organization and ratifying ILO Conventions Nos. 100 (1951) on Equal Remuneration, 111 (1958) on Discrimination (Employment and Occupation) and 156 (1981) on Workers with Family Responsibilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the number and capacity of public day-care nurseries and public day schools

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that flexible work arrangements and part-time work are available for men, in addition to women, in the public and private sectors

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that efforts are made to encourage men to make use of such arrangements (flexible work arrangements and part-time work  in the public and private sectors)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promote responsible fatherhood, including by providing incentives such as paid parental leave for fathers to encourage them to participate more actively in child-raising and to share equally other domestic duties

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in family and economy
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Undertake research on the economic consequences of divorce on both spouses, with specific attention to the enhanced human capital and earning potential of male spouses on the basis of their full-time and uninterrupted career pattern, and include information on the outcome of such research in its next periodic report

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in family and economy
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that the concept of joint marital property extends to intangible property, including pension and insurance benefits and other career assets, and take further legal measures, as needed, so as to compensate for the unequal share of women in unpaid work

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: systematically adopt such laws on temporary special measures including goals and time-tables or quotas, enhanced by a system of incentives, and effectively implement them in order to accelerate the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in the areas of political and public life, education and public and private employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enhance the education and in-service training of the teaching and counselling staff for all educational establishments and at all levels with regard to gender equality issues, to speedily complete a revision of all educational textbooks and materials to eliminate gender stereotypes, and to apply temporary special measures according to article 4, paragraph 1 of the Convention to encourage women to move into decision-making positions in educational institutions and to increase the number of women professors among academic staff

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop and implement programmes aimed at counselling girls and women on non-traditional educational and vocational choices

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that comprehensive legal and other measures are in place to address all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
