recommendation: allocate sufficient financial resources to ensure the effective implementation of the National Strategy for Combating Violence against Women and to closely monitor its results

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all women who are victims of domestic violence, including rural women, have access to immediate means of redress and protection, including protection orders…as well as to legal aid

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all women who are victims of domestic violence, including rural women, have access to a sufficient number of safe and adequately funded shelters

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: elaborate a specific law on domestic violence against women, which provides for redress and protection, without delay and set a timeframe for its adoption

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: improve research and data collection on the prevalence, causes and consequences of violence against women, including information on the relationship between the perpetrator and the victim in the instances of violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prioritize the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in the labour market, so as to achieve full compliance with article 11 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take concrete measures, including temporary special measures, to eliminate both vertical and horizontal occupational segregation and close the gender-based wage gap between women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider amending the Law on Equal Opportunities for Women and Men to include mandatory equality plans by public and private employers, also covering pay issues and family-friendly policies, to be monitored by the Equal Opportunities Ombudsman

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to ensure reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and to promote equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by increasing the incentives for men to use their right to parental leave

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvanted women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take effective measures to integrate these women (disadvantaged women), where appropriate into programs of life-long learning and the Lithuanian labour market, including by establishing women resource centres in rural areas

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct regular and comprehensive studies on intersectional forms of discrimination against such vulnerable groups of women, to collect statistics on their educational, employment and health situation as well as on their access to decision-making positions in political life and on all forms of violence that they may experience, and to present such information in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt temporary special measures to promote substantive equality of women and men in such areas as education, employment and participation in political and public life and to address the situation of disadvantaged women in all areas covered by the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review, as a matter of priority, textbooks and materials at all levels of education to eliminate gender stereotypes, in addition to encouraging the media to project positive images of women and the equal status of women and men in public and private life

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expedite the harmonization of legislation in accordance with the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expedite the ratification of the Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt a comprehensive strategy, which would complement the National Programme for the Prevention of Domestic Violence and Provision of Assistance to Victims for 2014-2020, aimed at eliminating sex- and gender-based violence against women in all its forms in public and private life, and set up an adequate coordinating and monitoring mechanism, or mandate an existing mechanism, to effectively prevent and eliminate all forms of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: regularly collect, analyse and publish data on cases of all forms of violence against women and girls that have been reported, investigated and prosecuted

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide crisis and walk-in centres that offer protection and assistance to all women who are victims of violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure an adequate geographical distribution and number of shelters and the provision of a range of services for victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the law on protection against domestic violence and relevant policies are implemented in a gender-sensitive manner

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively enforce and monitor compliance with protection orders imposed on perpetrators of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively prosecute and punish perpetrators of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: end the use of reconciliatory mediation for victims of domestic violence and refrain from adopting reconciliatory mediation in the criminal process, given that such procedures may increase the vulnerability of women who are victims of violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: amend the Criminal Code with a view to explicitly criminalizing marital rape

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt comprehensive legislation and policies against trafficking in persons, in particular women and children

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that (trafficking) victims are properly identified and provided with adequate protection and assistance

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the effective prosecution and punishment of traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Build the capacity of law enforcement officers, including police officers, prosecutors and the judiciary, immigration officers and social workers with regard to gender-sensitive ways to deal with victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that women and girls who are victims of trafficking have access to medical care, legal aid, psychosocial counselling and rehabilitation and reintegration programmes, regardless of their ability or willingness to testify against traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Impose adequate sanctions on law enforcement officers convicted in trafficking cases

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address the root causes of trafficking and prostitution by increasing efforts to provide educational and income-generating opportunities for women and girls, thereby minimizing their vulnerability to exploitation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take appropriate measures to combat exploitation of prostitution, including by criminalizing demand for prostitution

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: To adopt temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4 (1) of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25 on the subject, including quotas, to increase the participation of women, in particular rural women, women from ethnic minorities and women with disabilities, in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to eliminate gender stereotyping against women politicians

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: bring its national citizenship legislation in line with the 1961 Convention on the Reduction of Statelessness, in particular by providing for the automatic granting of nationality to all children born in Lithuania, including Roma children, who would otherwise be stateless

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Eliminate gender stereotypes and structural barriers that may deter girls from enrolling in non-traditional educational and occupational fields at all levels of education

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Consider adopting temporary special measures to accelerate the appointment of women in academic institutions, such as setting clear targets and time frames for promoting the recruitment of women to management positions in educational institutions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review all textbooks to eliminate gender stereotypes

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for Roma women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue legal and policy reforms to allow all girls to enjoy the right to education, and to that end ensure the enrolment of Roma girls and boys in regular classes at primary schools instead of schools or classes for children with special needs;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take specific measures to eliminate the horizontal and vertical segregation between women and men in the labour market, including temporary special measures to promote the access of women, in particular young women, to all forms of employment and occupation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: update national legislation and policies in order to promote equal opportunities and equal treatment of women in respect of employment and occupation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Develop support programmes aimed at counselling girls and women on non-traditional educational and vocational choices and career options in such areas as science and technology

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the effective implementation of the provisions of the Labour Code with regard to equal pay for work of equal value, including through labour inspections and the imposition of sanction

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: address the limited effectiveness of provisions on remuneration (in the Labour Code), in particular through public campaigns and awareness-raising within associations of employers and trade unions in the State party

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide for the integration and effective participation of women from disadvantaged groups, including migrant women, Roma women, single mothers, older women and women with disabilities, in the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue its efforts to ensure the reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and promote the equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by developing incentives to encourage more men to avail themselves of parental leave and ensuring the provision of affordable and accessible childcare facilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend the law on equal opportunities for women and men to include mandatory equality plans by public and private employers, covering also pay issues and family-friendly policies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Investigate claims of undocumented forced abortions and sterilization of women with intellectual disabilities in care institutions,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put protocols in place to ensure compliance with the legal requirement of court authorization in such cases [undocumented forced abortions and sterilization of women] and ensure that offenders are punished

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Develop comprehensive policies and programmes aimed at the economic and political empowerment of rural women and ensure their access to health, education and services, including shelters for victims of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take specific action to tackle violence against women with disabilities by providing accessible shelters and 24-hour victim support hotlines, training police officers and raising awareness of such violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: repeal without delay the discriminatory provisions of the amendment to the Civil Code that lowered the legal age of consent to marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up its efforts to assist women and men in striking a balance between family and employment responsibilities, inter alia, through further awareness-raising and education initiatives for both women and men on adequate sharing of care of children and domestic tasks as well as ensuring that part-time employment is not taken up almost exclusively by women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider the findings of the Labour Force Survey, undertaken in 2006 by STATEC, on women’s situation in the labour market and to adopt new measures that better address women employment challenges, including the provision of additional childcare facilities for children of different age groups

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify and expand its efforts to prevent and address all forms of violence against women, including sexual violence, rape, sexual exploitation, including pornography, in accordance with the Committee’s general recommendation 19, as well as utilizing the Secretary-General’s in-depth study on all forms of violence against women (A/61/122 and Add.1 and Add.1/Corr.1).

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place a comprehensive strategy and action plan to prevent and eliminate all forms of violence against women, including in the immigrant community, as well as an effective institutional mechanism to coordinate, monitor and assess the effectiveness of measures taken

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its awareness-raising efforts with regard to all forms of violence against women and the unacceptability of all such violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to correct the violent behaviours of the offenders and to provide support services and sufficient number of shelters for women victims of violence, staffed by expert personnel and provided with adequate financial resources for their effective functioning

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the systematic collection and publication of data, disaggregated by type of violence and by the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim, and to use such data as the basis for monitoring the implementation of current and future policy and support measures

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: evaluate the resistance and obstacles to women’s full and equal participation in public life and decision-making, especially at higher levels.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: use temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendations 25 on temporary special measures, and 23 on women in political and public life

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the representation of women in political and public bodies reflects the full diversity of the population

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide detailed sex-disaggregated data and information on the representation of women in elected and appointed bodies and in the judiciary, including at the decision-making level, and trends over time, in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: emphasize that realization of women’s de facto equality with men in the labour market, including in the private sector, so as to achieve compliance with article 11 of the Convention, is an obligation of the State party under the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt policies and take all necessary measures, including special temporary measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and general recommendation 25, with time-bound targets, to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: mainstream the issues of immigrant women, who may suffer multiple discriminations, into its employment policies and programmes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt further measures to narrow and close the pay gap between women and men and to adopt mechanisms to monitor the implementation of the principle of equal pay for equal work of work of equal value

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its data collection and analysis efforts to monitor the effectiveness of policy and measures adopted to improve the employment situation of women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee invites the State party to include, in its next report, information on the extent of use and impact of affirmative action in the private sector, and information on measures taken to improve the situation of women in the labour market and their impact

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its programme aimed at diversifying academic and vocational choices for girls and boys and take further measures to encourage girls to pursue untraditional education fields

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for foreing girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: closely monitor the situation of girls of foreign origin in all educational levels and to continue to address the difficulties they experience in the school system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide, in its next report, comprehensive information on the prevalence of trafficking to and out of Luxembourg as well as information on the impact of measures taken and results achieved

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accelerate the adoption of the anti-trafficking bill and requests the State party

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures to ensure better identification and investigation of trafficking cases, particularly through enhanced training and capacity-building efforts for law enforcement officials so as to increase their ability to identify potential victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: further strengthen bilateral, regional and international cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination of trafficking victims so as to further curb this phenomenon

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen  existing  criminal  and  family  law  or  adopt  a  comprehensive law  addressing  all  forms  of  violence  against  women,  including  domestic  and  sexual violence,  and  ensure  that  all  women  and  girls  who  are  victims  of  violence  are protected  by  such  legislation  and  have  access  to  immediate  means  of  redress  and protection and further ensure that perpetrators are prosecuted and punished

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Raise public awareness, through the media and educational programmes (all forms of violence against women and girls)

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide  mandatory  training  for  judges,  prosecutors,  lawyers,  police  officers, health-service providers  and  social services  and teaching  staff in order to ensure that they are sensitized to all forms of violence against women and girls and can provide adequate gender-sensitive support to victims

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women and women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Encourage women to report incidents of domestic and sexual violence by raising  awareness  about  the  criminal  nature  of  such  acts  and  provide  adequate assistance and protection to women victims of violence, including Roma women and women from other ethnic minorities

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women and women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase  the  number  and  funding  of  shelters  and  guarantee  national coverage,  including  for  women  from  ethnic  minorities  and  women  from  other disadvantaged groups affected by violence

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Enhance  the  system  of  data  collection  to  ensure  that  data  are disaggregated  by  type  of  violence  and  by  the  relationship  of  the  perpetrator  to  the victim, support research in this field and ensure that information and collected data are available to the public

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expeditiously  ratify  the  Council  of  Europe  Convention  on  preventing and combating violence against  women  and domestic violence  and introduce criminal sanctions for non-compliance with restraining orders

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Effectively  implement  the  National  Strategy  against  Trafficking  by strengthening  the  visibility  and  cooperation  between  the  relevant  institutional mechanisms,  monitoring the  National Referral Mechanism  for victims of trafficking in human beings and  by providing  funding for anti-trafficking activities  by relevant national institutions and non-governmental organizations

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women and women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address  the  root  causes  of  trafficking  and  exploitation  of  women  and girls  by  increasing  its  efforts  to  prevent  the  trafficking  of  all  women  and  girls, including Roma women and girls

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Pursue  a  comprehensive  approach  in  addressing  the  exploitation  of prostitution,  including  by  developing  strategies  and  implementing  programmes  to support  and  provide  rehabilitation  for  women  who  wish  to  leave  prostitution,  and ensure  the  investigation,  prosecution  and  punishment  of  those  who  exploit prostitution

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accelerate  the  full  and  equal participation of women in political and public life and increase the number of women in  decision-making  positions,  including  by  adopting  temporary  special  measures

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: create  an  enabling  environment  for  political participation of women, including Roma and Albanian women, as well as encourage their participation through educational and  outreach programmes which are aimed at changing gendered perceptions of the role of women in political life

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide  comparative  data  disaggregated  by  sex  and  ethnicity  on  the rates of school enrolment, attendance and dropout rates

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address  barriers  to  the  education  of  all  women  and  girls,  such  as negative cultural attitudes and excessive domestic duties, to take steps to reduce and prevent  the  dropout  of  girls

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen  the  implementation  of  re-entry  policies enabling girls who drop out to return to school

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Investigate  and  urgently  address  the  recommendations  of  the  Office  of the  Ombudsman  which  call  for  the  regulation  and  review  of  findings  made  by institutions  authorized  to  determine  the  level  of  children’s  disabilities  and  special needs, including those of Roma girls

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen efforts to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and to adopt measures  to implement the principle of equal pay for work of  equal  value  and  to  narrow  and  close  the  wage  gap  between  women  and  men  by applying job evaluation schemes in the public sector connected with wage increases in sectors dominated by women

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase  women’s,  including  Roma  women  and  women  belonging  to other disadvantaged groups,  access  to formal employment and entrepreneurship  and improve their possibilities to combine working life with family responsibilities

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect sex-disaggregated data on the situation of women and men in the labour market and on the number and outcome of labour inspections, court cases and administrative  complaints  related  to  sex-based  labour  discrimination  and  sexual harassment in the workplace

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify efforts to enhance the economic and political empowerment of women in rural areas, including by reviewing the causes of the low percentage of women who own land and have access to credit facilities

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Include in next  periodic report information on rural women’s access to education, social and health services, and to the formal labour market

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: raise awareness among Roma  and Albanian  communities about the prohibition of child marriage, as well  as  on  its  harmful  effects  on  girls’  health  and  education

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively investigate  and  prosecute  cases  of  forced  and  early  marriage

reportconsidered: combined fourth and fifth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt measures to register all marriages, including those taking place within Roma and Albanian communities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up its efforts to assist women and men in striking a balance between family and employment responsibilities, inter alia, through further awareness-raising and education initiatives for both women and men on adequate sharing of child rearing responsibilities and domestic tasks

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up its efforts to improve the availability, affordability and quality of childcare facilities for school-age children in order to facilitate the re-entry of women into the labour market

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider amending the Employment and Industrial Relations Act in order to enable employees in the private sector to benefit from similar flexible working arrangements and special leave provisions as employees in the public sector

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to monitor the use of the parental leave provisions by women and men as an indicator of shared family responsibilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop incentives to encourage more men to avail themselves of parental leave and to facilitate childcare services for all working parents in need of them

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its efforts to ensure that female victims of violence have immediate protection, including the possibility of expelling the perpetrator from the family home, effective recourse to a shelter

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its efforts to ensure that female victims of violence have immediate protection, including access to free legal aid and psycho-social counselling

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensuring that public officials, especially law enforcement officials, members of the judiciary, health-care providers and social workers, are fully sensitized to all forms of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: systematize data collection on violence against women, including domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: structures be established to help female victims of violence rebuild their lives, including through the creation of job opportunities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: pursue, in collaboration with a broad range of stakeholders, including women’s and other civil society organizations, awareness-raising campaigns through the media and public education programmes to make such violence socially unacceptable

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: define the crimes of rape and violent assault as crimes against the physical and mental integrity of women and as a form of sex and gender based-discrimination that seriously inhibits women’s ability to enjoy their human rights and fundamental freedoms on a basis of equality with men. If further urges the State party to review the definition of rape so as to place the lack of consent at its centre

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide, in next periodic report, comprehensive information on the prevalence of trafficking in Malta

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures to ensure better identification and investigation of trafficking cases, particularly through the establishment of a mechanism to proactively ensure identification of and support for trafficked persons as well as enhanced training and capacity-building efforts for law enforcement officials, including immigration officials, so as to increase their ability to identify potential victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its measures to combat all forms of trafficking in women and children, including through increased international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin and transit, in line with article 6 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the prosecution and punishment of individuals involved in trafficking, but also the protection and recovery of victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider using the Recommended Principles and Guidelines on Human Rights and Human Trafficking developed by the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights in 2002 as a basis for its plan of action

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect and analyse data on all aspects of trafficking, disaggregated by age, sex and country of origin, in order to identify trends. The State party is encouraged to undertake a study on the issue of trafficking, including the root causes, with a view to identifying priority areas for action, and to formulate relevant policies

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to strengthen women’s representation in leadership roles and in decision-making positions in political bodies, including Parliament and local councils, in public administration, including the diplomatic service, and in the private sector

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expand its current awareness-raising efforts and training activities to a wider range of stakeholders, including leaders of political parties, senior managers in the private sector and boards of trustees of foundations under public laww

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures, in particular temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25 and general recommendation No. 23 (1997) on women in political and public life, so as to accelerate the achievement of women’s full and equal participation at all levels and in all areas

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to systematically monitor policies, structures and processes related to promoting gender equality identified in the National Strategic Plan for implementation of the National Minimum Curriculum

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: special attention be given to the establishment of structures such as the education committee in gender equity and the monitoring committee

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: information on specific outcomes related to achieving gender equality be provided in the next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: revise the decision to remove technical vocational subjects from the secondary level and to empirically assess its impact on female participation in technical courses at the Malta College of Arts, Science and Technology (MCAST), as well as female underrepresentation in the critical areas of science, mathematics, computing and engineering, manufacturing and construction

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market through, inter alia, temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and general recommendation No. 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: efforts be strengthened to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and to narrow and close the wage gap between women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct regular reviews of its legislation in accordance with article 11, paragraph 3, of the Convention, with a view to eliminating barriers women face in the labour market, including the obstacles to achieve managerial positions - monitor the impact of measures taken and results achieved and to report thereon in its next periodic report

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in public sphere
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its next periodic report information on cases of sexual harassment and their outcome

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: introduce and to vigorously support legislation which permits divorce, allows women to remarry after divorce, and grants women and men the same rights to administer property during marriage and equal rights to property on divorce

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure women and men be granted equal rights to initiate divorce proceedings

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to review its current legal system governing marriage and family relations with a view to extending existing legal provisions to couples living in de facto unions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expedite its efforts to adopt the proposed amendment to Law No. 64-XII on government

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: raise the awareness of parliamentarians regarding the importance of the engagement of women in public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public life for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4 (1) of the Convention, where women, including those from ethnic minorities and those with disabilities, are underrepresented or disadvantaged, and evaluate and publish gender impact analyses of the measures

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: eliminate all forms of sex- and gender-based discrimination throughout the education system and in informal education programmes with a view to removing gender stereotypes from educational materials, incorporating human rights education into school curricula and introducing mandatory courses in all teacher training programmes on ways in which schooling reproduces gender inequalities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop a comprehensive strategy across all sectors, targeted at women and men, girls and boys, to overcome patriarchal and gender-based stereotypical attitudes concerning the roles and responsibilities of women and men in the family and in society

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop public awareness and training programmes for decision makers, employers, young people and disadvantaged groups of women, including older women and women with disabilities, on women’s rights in all areas covered by the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen the enforcement of the Criminal Code, Law No. 45-XVI on preventing and combating domestic violence and other relevant national legislation

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all women and girls, including in particular older women, Roma women and girls and women and girls with disabilities, are protected from violence and have access to immediate means of redress

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide adequate assistance and protection to women victims of violence, including Roma women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase the number and funding of shelters and guarantee national coverage extending to women from rural areas and Transnistria

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and women minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all investigations into acts of sexual violence, including those committed against Moldovan migrant women, are carried out in line with international standards of investigation, including by amending the existing guidelines on investigation of rape and other forms of sexual assault

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enhance the system of data collection to ensure that data are disaggregated by type of violence and by relationship between the perpetrator and the victim, support research in this field and ensure that the information and data collected are made available to the public

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ratify the Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the timely prosecution and commensurate punishment of traffickers and review its sentencing policy in trafficking cases

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide mandatory and gender-sensitive training for judges, prosecutors, police officers and other law enforcement officers on legal provisions relating to trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively implement the action plans of the Strategy of the National Referral System to Protect and Assist Victims and Potential Victims of Trafficking in Human Beings, which are aimed at the early identification and referral of victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take preventive measures such as raising the awareness of disadvantaged and marginalized groups of women of the risks of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review laws on prostitution in order to ensure that women in prostitution are not discriminated against or penalized by administrative fines

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up its efforts to support women who wish to leave prostitution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement measures to decrease demand for prostitution, including the potential introduction of sanctions for sex buyers

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Study the root causes that prevent women from participation in public and political life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: design strategies to overcome such obstacles (prevent women from participating in public and political life) and take effective measures to ensure that the proposed temporary special measures aimed at advancing women in political life and in leadership positions are swiftly adopted

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase its efforts to provide training and capacity-building for women to enable them to enter public office, and enhance awareness-raising campaigns on the importance of the full and equal participation of women in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Introduce procedures to ensure the effective participation of Roma women and women with disabilities in elected offices and appointed bodies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Encourage young women to choose non-traditional fields of study and professions, including through the adoption of temporary special measures and  implement programmes aimed at counselling boys and girls on the full range of educational choices

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for Roma girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promote access by Roma girls and girls with disabilities to high-quality mainstream and inclusive education and their retention at all levels of education, including by tackling anti-Roma sentiment, raise awareness of the importance of education as the basis for the empowerment of women and strengthen the implementation of re-entry policies enabling girls who have dropped out to return to school

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen efforts to eliminate occupational segregation, including through the adoption of temporary special measures, , and adopt measures to implement the principle of equal pay for work of equal value and, and close the gender wage gap by applying job evaluation schemes in the public sector connected with wage increases in sectors dominated by women

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for Roma women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase access by Roma women, women in rural areas, women with disabilities and older women to formal employment by, among other things, ensuring the effective implementation of the National Programme on Ensuring Gender Equality for 2010-2015

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Step up its efforts to review the provisions of the Labour Code on maternity and paternity leave and engage trade unions and women’s organizations with a view to enabling women and men to reconcile professional and family responsibilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Raise the retirement age for women so that it is the same as that for men and expand pension schemes in order to ensure at least the minimum subsistence level for women and men

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in the public sphere
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: disseminate and effectively implement the legislation prohibiting and criminalizing sexual harassment in the workplace, ensure that women are aware of that legislation and have access to effective civil and criminal law remedies

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in the public sphere
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: gather sex-disaggregated data on the number and outcome of labour inspections, court cases and administrative complaints relating to sex-based labour discrimination and sexual harassment in the workplace

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: amend and develop the regulatory framework, in addition to the guidance provided to medical practitioners, to ensure that sterilization is carried out only in conformity with international law, in particular with the free and informed consent of the women concerned

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Step up efforts to enhance the economic and political empowerment of women in rural areas

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Include in its next periodic report information and gender-disaggregated data on the access of women in rural areas to land, credit, social and health services and the formal labour market

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: integrate a gender perspective into the new Land Code

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: effectively investigate all cases of sexual assault against women with disabilities in residential institutions, facilitate access by such women to high-quality reproductive health care and ensure that all medical interventions are based on informed consent

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the social welfare authorities and other State agencies take measures to combat the practice of child marriage and effectively implement the legislation prohibiting early marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: raise awareness among Roma communities about the legal prohibition of child marriage and the negative effects of such marriage on the health and education of girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that all reports of domestic and sexual violence against women and girls are effectively investigated and that perpetrators are prosecuted and sentenced commensurate with the gravity of their crimes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide mandatory training to judges, prosecutors and police officers on standardized procedures for dealing with victims in a gender-sensitive manner and on the application of protection orders under the Law on Protection against Family Violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expedite the adoption of implementing regulations under the Law (on Protection against Family Violence) and identify any gaps in the application of protection orders in criminal proceedings

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide adequate assistance and protection to women victims of violence, in particular psychosocial rehabilitation and an adequate number of shelter facilities funded by the State party, as well as funding for NGOs that assist victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct research and collect comprehensive statistical data on violence against women, disaggregated by sex, age and relationship between the victim and perpetrator and carry out an in-depth analysis of the research and statistical data and utilize them to design policies and measures to combat violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Set a time frame for ratifying the Council of Europe Convention on preventing and combating violence against women and domestic violence (2011)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review its sentencing policy in trafficking cases and provide mandatory training for judges, prosecutors, and police officers on the appropriate application of article 444 of the Criminal Code and of relevant provisions on witness protection in the Criminal Procedure Code and the Witness Protection Law

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify training for immigration and other law enforcement officials on early identification of (potential) victims of trafficking, with a special focus on women and girls who are particularly vulnerable to trafficking such as Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian women, displaced women, and unaccompanied or street girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite efforts to establish a national mechanism for compensating victims of trafficking and strengthen programmes for their reintegration into society

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Broaden the cooperation with NGOs in implementing and monitoring the National Strategy for the Fight against Trafficking in Human Beings and the related Action Plan and provide funding for anti-trafficking activities of NGOs

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide information in its next periodic report on the number of temporary residence permits granted to trafficking victims, including where those victims are unwilling or unable to cooperate with the prosecution authorities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Further intensify efforts to combat sexual exploitation of girls and boys

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review the quota of 30 per cent in the Electoral Law to ensure that in each group of three candidates, at least one candidate is a woman on political parties’ electoral lists

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Introduce legislative measures and procedures for the implementation of article 10 of the Law on Gender Equality, including provisions on the rejection of proposals for appointments that do not comply with the principle of gender-balanced representation, unless there are justifiable reasons for exemption from this principle

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt other temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25 (2004) on temporary special measures, such as a gender parity system for appointments and accelerated recruitment of women in the public service, especially in senior positions

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Remove discriminatory practices and address cultural barriers that prevent women from moving into decision-making and management positions in the education sector and so ensure proportionate representation of women and men in principal positions

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide incentives for political parties to nominate equal numbers of women and men as candidates and harmonize their statutes with the Law on Gender Equality, e.g. through party financing and by encouraging broadcasting media to allocate extra time to those parties during electoral campaigns

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create an enabling environment for political participation of women, including Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian women, e.g. by adequately funding campaigns of women candidates, educating young women leaders, and strengthening women’s wings of political parties

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify efforts aimed at diversifying academic and vocational choices for women and men and take further measures to encourage women and men to choose non-traditional fields of education and careers

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt further temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, to increase enrolment and completion rates of Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian girls and boys, as well as the participation of Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian women and girls in higher education

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Train and recruit more Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian teachers, including women, allocate sufficient resources for improving the quality of education in schools in and around the Konik refugee camps, and intensify efforts to integrate Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian children into local schools

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide mandatory training to teachers who are not Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian on their obligations to report incidents of abuse and harassment of Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian girls and boys and to refrain from such acts

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue raising awareness among Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian families about the importance of education for the life and career prospects of girls and provide further incentives to those parents to send their daughters to school

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that the Law on Changes to the Labour Law expressly provides for equal remuneration of women and men for work of equal value, protects the rights of women employed on fixed-term contracts to paid maternity leave and to return to work after childbirth and introduces special non-transferable paternity leave to promote the active participation of fathers in child-raising

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Sensitize employers and employees on flexible work arrangements for women and men and encourage men to make use of such arrangements, further raise awareness about responsible fatherhood

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase the number and capacity of affordable childcare facilities in all parts of the State party

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect sex-disaggregated data on the situation of women and men in the labour market and on the number and outcome of labour inspections, court cases and administrative complaints related to sex-based labour discrimination and sexual harassment, and include such data in its next periodic report

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Effectively implement existing and adopt additional policies and targeted measures with time-bound targets and indicators to achieve substantive equality of men and women in the labour market, promote employment of women, including Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian women, eliminate occupational segregation, and close the gender wage gap.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in ecomonic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt targeted measures and programmes to economically empower single mothers and ensure that they and their children have adequate and affordable access to  housing, education, professional training, health care and cultural life, and protect them against discrimination and abuse

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Undertake research on the economic consequences of divorce on both spouses, with specific attention to the enhanced human capital and earning potential of male spouses on the basis of their full-time and uninterrupted career pattern, and include information on the outcome of such research in its next periodic report

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that the concept of joint marital property extends to intangible property, including pension and insurance benefits and other career assets and that joint property is divided equally regardless of each spouse’s individual contribution, and take further legal measures, as needed, so as to compensate for the unequal share of women in unpaid work

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its efforts to raise awareness among Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian communities about the prohibition of forced and child marriages, as well as on the harmful effects on girls’ mental and reproductive health, and effectively investigate, prosecute and punish cases of forced and early marriage

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public  life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take sustained measures to accelerate women’s full and equal participation in public life and decision-making, especially in high-ranking posts, at the provincial and municipal levels and in the private and business sectors

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public  life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: use temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendations 25 on temporary special measures, and 23 on women in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public  life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the representation of women in political and public bodies reflects the full diversity of the population and to include immigrant, refugee and minority women

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public  life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide detailed sex-disaggregated data and information on the representation of women, including immigrant, refugee and minority women, in elected and appointed bodies, including at the decision-making level, and trends over time in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the systematic collection of statistical data disaggregated by sex, by type of violence, by the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim and by ethnicity

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: proceed with the elaboration of effective protection orders (violence against women) and monitor the impact of its laws, policies and programmes on the persistence of violence against women and trends over time

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the impact of its laws, policies and programmes on the persistence of violence against women and trends over time

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: engage in awareness-raising campaigns on violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to ensure that free legal aid is provided to all victims of domestic violence so that they can seek access to justice and remedies and make informed decisions regarding, inter alia, criminal proceedings and family law

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to appoint a neutral, independent body to conduct an impact assessment of the intended as well as unintended effects of the law abolishing the ban on brothels. Such an assessment should also cover the risks of violence and health risks, in particular for women without residence permits who are engaged in prostitution - provide the findings of such an assessment in its next report, including information about steps and measures taken in response thereto

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide information in its next report on the number of women and minor girls who are victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: It calls upon the State party to provide for the extension of temporary protection visas, reintegration and support services to all victims of trafficking, including those who are unable or unwilling to cooperate in the investigation and prosecution of traffickers

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to eliminate occupational segregation, in particular through the further diversification of educational and training opportunities, and to take steps to ensure that all wage differentials in the workplace are eliminated

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: create more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment and to encourage men, including through awareness-raising, to share responsibility for childcare equally

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt legislation designed to ensure that companies and organizations introduce proper complaints mechanisms, as well as to reinstate maternity benefits for all women in line with article 11 (2) (b) of the Convention

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider the findings of the Equal Pay Working Group, which is due to report in 2007, and to take relevant follow-up steps

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Aruba compile data, including sex‑disaggregated data, on prostitution and trafficking and include such information in its next report.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Aruba pass specific legislation on violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: introduce a consistent scheme for promoting equality in public contracts

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: urges the Netherlands Antilles and Aruba to promptly enact legislation providing for temporary restraining orders to be imposed on perpetrators of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: urges Aruba to provide training to the police, law enforcement personnel and health personnel so that they may properly investigate and deal with domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the specificities of domestic violence targeting women be fully taken into consideration in the formulation of the new plan of action against domestic violence starting in 2011

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure without any further delay that free legal aid is provided to all victims of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: not to use the joint plan for parenthood as a legal precondition for starting divorce proceedings and in no case to impose it on women victims of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: urges the Netherlands Antilles to adopt without delay legislation criminalizing all forms of human trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that relevant NGOs are fully integrated into the membership of the anti-trafficking task force
