recommendation: Increase awareness-raising programmes, especially among the Roma population, on the harmful impact of child and/or forced marriage on the health, development and education of girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide victims of child and/or forced marriage with appropriate rehabilitation and counselling services and shelters

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: raise the awareness of the staff of social work centres regarding how to identify and deal with girls who are victims of harmful practices in a gender-sensitive manner

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct an in-depth study on child, early and forced marriage, in particular among the Roma population, to determine its root causes and assess its magnitude

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement targeted programmes in the education system, including human rights education and the dissemination of the Convention, the revision of school textbooks and curricula, and the training of teachers

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: targeted measures for the media and the education system to promote positive images of ethnic and minority women, Roma women, migrant women and women with disabilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to intensify its efforts to address the issue of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: analyse all cases of violence against women, particularly those that result in murders of women, to identify any trends and underlying causes behind the increased severity of violence committed against women,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: identify any trends and underlying causes behind the increased severity of violence committed against women, and to ensure the adoption of appropriate and effective measures to prevent such violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of training activities and programmes for parliamentarians, the judiciary, public officials and law enforcement personnel, and health-service providers, so as to ensure that they are sensitized to all forms of violence against women and can provide adequate support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of public awareness-raising campaigns on all forms of violence against women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take all appropriate measures to combat all forms of trafficking in women and children and exploitative prostitution in line with article 6 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: incorporate a human rights perspective, as well as the principles and recommended practices contained in the related international instruments, in any reform of its national legislation so as to address not only criminal justice measures and the prosecution of traffickers, but also the protection and rehabilitation of victims and the provision of adequate support services

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase its efforts at international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination in order to prevent trafficking and to bring perpetrators to justice

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: afford full protection under the Convention relating to the Status of Refugees to trafficked women who seek asylum on grounds of gender-based persecution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to collect and analyse data, disaggregated by age and country of origin, in order to identify trends and root causes, as well as priority areas for action, and to formulate relevant policies

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market, including through the use of temporary special measures, with time-bound targets, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and its general recommendation No. 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take proactive and concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, through, inter alia, education, training and retraining and effective enforcement mechanisms, and to narrow and close the pay gap

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the incorporation of a gender perspective in the development and implementation of any programme or stimulus package implemented as a response to the world financial and economic crisis

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor trends, including through the collection and analysis of data disaggregated by sex, occupational sector, and full or part-time work, on the impact of the measures taken, and the results achieved

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: requirements for the adoption of equality plans should be extended to all small and medium-sized companies (with fewer than 250 employees)

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, and health for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: give full attention to the needs of rural women and ensure that all policies and programmes aimed at promoting gender equality, including those with regard to health, education, employment and elimination of violence against women, reach the rural areas and are fully implemented at all levels

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in educaiton and employment for Roma women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its next report comprehensive information on the situation of Roma women and girls, including data on their education opportunities and achievements, access to employment and health-care services, and participation in public life and decision-making

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy for Roma women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt the measures that are necessary so as to guarantee and safeguard the economic rights of all Roma women regardless of whether or not their marriages are registered

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education, employment, health for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to be proactive in its measures, including through the development of targeted programmes and strategies, to increase women’s awareness of and access to education, health and social services, training and employment, as well as to familiarize them with their rights to gender equality and non-discrimination

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect statistics disaggregated by sex in all relevant areas, especially on all aspects of employment in the public and private sectors

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place a comprehensive strategy with proactive and sustained measures to eliminate gender stereotypes, by reviewing its legislation relating to education

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place a comprehensive strategy with proactive and sustained measures to eliminate gender stereotypes, by adopting targeted programmes in the education system, by revising textbooks and curricula and conducting awareness-raising campaigns directed at women and men generally and at media and advertising agencies specifically

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: use innovative measures targeting the media to strengthen understanding of substantive equality of women and men and use the education system to promote positive and non-stereotypical portrayals of women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor and review the measures taken (to strengthen understanding of equality of women and men in education system) to assess their impact and take appropriate action

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: revise its legislation on violence against women to include other forms of gender-based violence, such as violence by care providers, police violence and violence in public spaces, workplaces and schools

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide mandatory training for judges, prosecutors, police officers and other law enforcement officials on the Convention and the Optional Protocol and on the strict application of criminal law provisions on violence against women and on gender-sensitive procedures for interviewing and treating women who are victims of violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: put in place comprehensive measures to prevent and address violence against women and girls and ensure that women and girls who are victims of violence have access to immediate means of redress and protection and that perpetrators are prosecuted and adequately punished

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage women to report incidents of domestic and sexual violence to law enforcement bodies by destigmatizing victims, sensitizing the police and judiciary and raising awareness about the criminal nature of such acts

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide adequate assistance and protection to women who are victims of violence by providing sufficient shelters, including in rural areas, and enhancing State cooperation with non-governmental organizations providing shelter and rehabilitation to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect statistical data on domestic and sexual violence disaggregated by sex, age, nationality and relationship between the victim and the perpetrator

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt comprehensive anti-trafficking legislation with a gender perspective and an explicit definition of trafficking in persons in accordance with international standards

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to intensify efforts aimed at bilateral, regional and international cooperation to prevent trafficking and prosecute traffickers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a comprehensive approach to address the phenomenon of exploitation of prostitution; collect data and undertake analysis;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a comprehensive approach to address the phenomenon of exploitation of prostitution; provide sufficient shelters, crisis centres and exit and reintegration programmes, as well as alternative income-generating opportunities for women who wish to leave prostitution; and take measures to reduce the demand for prostitution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a comprehensive definition of pimping to make possible the adequate prosecution of those who exploit prostitution

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the participation of women in political and public life at all levels, including by adopting temporary special measures, such as statutory quotas, in accordance with article 4 (1) of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Build the capacity of and increase access to campaign financing for women candidates to enable them to compete effectively with their male counterparts

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct awareness-raising activities for politicians, community leaders, journalists and the general public on the importance of the participation of women in decision-making in order to promote understanding that the full, equal, free and democratic participation of women on an equal basis with men in political and public life, including in international representation, is a requirement for the full implementation of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify its efforts to provide specific training and to diversify academic and vocational choices for women and men and take further measures to encourage women and men to choose non-traditional fields of education and careers

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that all gender stereotypes are eliminated from textbooks and that school curricula

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that academic programmes and professional training for teachers cover women’s rights and promote gender equality

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for Roma women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take effective measures to retain Roma girls in school and increase their enrolment through temporary special measures such as scholarships and free provision of textbooks

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review its legislation and policies in order to promote equal opportunities and equal treatment of women in employment, including career opportunities, and to limit the exposure of women to segregated and precarious work

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Restore the financing of the implementation of Law No. 39/2006 on the promotion of personal autonomy and care for dependent people

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to take specific and proactive measures to eliminate the gender pay gap and create more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to achieve the equal and full participation of women in decision-making in the economic sphere, in particular on the boards of directors of large companies, by introducing mandatory quotas

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt temporary special measures to accelerate the equal participation of women from disadvantaged groups in the labour market, including migrant women, Roma women, single mothers, older women and women with disabilities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake comprehensive studies on the employment and working conditions of those groups of women (Roma and other women), with recommendations for enhancing their effective participation in the labour market

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: eliminate all barriers to the implementation of Law No. 35/2011 on shared ownership of agricultural enterprises.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: improve protection for women and girl asylum seekers in the autonomous cities of Ceuta and Melilla by ensuring that no violence is used at border controls, by ensuring access to asylum procedures for all claimants, regardless of their country of origin or mode of entry, by establishing a fair and efficient asylum procedure and by improving reception conditions and ensuring that gender is taken into account

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that legislation that sets joint physical custody as the default rule in determining cases of child custody is not adopted

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to adequately address the consideration of the specific needs of women and children to determine child custody in cases of domestic violence

documenttype: Communication No. 47/2012
recommendation: Grant the author appropriate reparation and comprehensive compensation commensurate with the seriousness of the infringement of her rights

documenttype: Communication No. 47/2012
recommendation: Conduct an exhaustive and impartial investigation to determine whether there are failures in the State’s structures and practices that have caused the author and her daughter to be deprived of protection

documenttype: Communication No. 47/2012
recommendation: Take appropriate and effective measures so prior acts of domestic violence will be taken into consideration when determining custody and visitation rights regarding children and so that the exercise of custody or visiting rights will not endanger the safety of the victims of violence, including the children. The best interests of the child and the child’s right to be heard must prevail in all decisions taken in this regard

documenttype: Communication No. 47/2012
recommendation: Strengthen application of the legal framework to ensure that the competent authorities exercise due diligence to respond appropriately to situations of domestic violence

documenttype: Communication No. 47/2012
recommendation: Provide mandatory training for judges and administrative personnel on the application of the legal framework with regard to combating domestic violence, including training on the definition of domestic violence and on gender stereotypes, as well as training with regard to the Convention, its Optional Protocol and the Committee’s general recommendations, particularly general recommendation 19

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its efforts to encourage an increase in the number of women in high-ranking posts, particularly in academia

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: employ and effectively implement temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention, and with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, in order to accelerate the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in all areas

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its gender equality legislation provisions to mandate the use of temporary special measures, including goals or quotas, enhanced by a system of incentives, in both the public and private sectors

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: future strategy on gender mainstreaming in the labour market and business sector should include effective monitoring and accountability mechanisms, including sanctions for non-compliance by employers and other relevant groups

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor developments with regard to women’s participation in top management positions with a view to further supporting such participation through legislative or policy initiatives and to provide information on results achieved, including relevant disaggregated statistical data

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: prioritize the realization of women’s de facto equality with men in the labour market, so as to achieve full compliance with article 11 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor trends, including through the collection and analysis of data disaggregated by sex, skills and sectors in part-time versus full-time work, as well as the impact of measures taken and results achieved, and to take the necessary corrective steps

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to ensure reconciliation of family and professional responsibilities and for the promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between women and men, including by increasing the incentives for men to use their right to parental leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proactive concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, and to narrow and close the wage gap between women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that comprehensive measures are in place to address all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence and crimes committed in the name of honour

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: allocate sufficient financial resources to ensure the effective implementation of the 2007 action plan on violence, to study and analyse all cases of violence against women, particularly those that result in murders of women, and to implement policies in order to prevent such violence, provide protection, support and services to the victims and punish and rehabilitate offenders

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to study and analyse all cases of violence against women, particularly those that result in murders of women, and to implement policies in order to prevent such violence, provide protection, support and services to the victims and punish and rehabilitate offenders

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect comprehensive statistical data disaggregated by sex, age and type of violence and the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide statistical information in its next periodic report on the number of women and girls living in Sweden who have been genitally mutilated

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take the necessary measures to ensure greater cooperation (regarding violence against women) between the central Government, the regional county administrative boards and the municipalities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the provision of social services with a view to ensuring the availability of a sufficient number of shelters (for victims of violence) equipped to accommodate women with disabilities throughout the territory of the State party and making sure that they are adequately financed

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures to suppress all forms of trafficking in women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide in its next report comprehensive information and data about trafficking in women and girls and information on the impact of measures taken and results achieved, including under the future national action programme for combating trafficking in human beings

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proper account of the recommendations of the Special Rapporteur on violence against women, its causes and consequences, following her visit to Sweden (A/HRC/4/34/Add.3), when formulating the national programme (on trafficking)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen the legislation allowing the prosecution of Swedish citizens involved in sexual exploitation of girls abroad, including by prohibiting the reissuance of passports for persons freed after posting bail

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its bilateral, regional and international cooperation so as to further curb this phenomenon, including in the context of the State party’s strategy on poverty and trafficking in human beings

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake research on the economic consequences of divorce on both spouses, with specific attention to the enhanced human capital and earning potential of male spouses on the basis of their full-time and un-interrupted career pattern, review its current legislation in light of the outcome of the research and include information to this effect in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to eliminate discrimination against immigrant, refugee and minority women

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take effective measures to integrate them (minority women) into the Swedish labour market

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health, and violence against minority womjen
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct regular and comprehensive studies on discrimination against immigrant, refugee and minority women, to collect statistics on their situation in employment, education and health and on all forms of violence that they may experience, and to submit such information in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to eliminate discrimination against women with disabilities, to combat violence against them and to recognize them as a particular group with particular needs

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase  the  use  of temporary special measures, including  statutory quotas, in all areas covered by the Convention in which women are underrepresented, such as decision -making positions in high-level public administration, private and public companies and academia - measures  should  include  specific  targets  an d  time  frames,  in accordance  with  article  4  (1)  of  the  Convention  and  the  Committee’s  general recommendation  No.  25  (2004)  on  temporary  special  measures,  in  order  to ensure the achievement of substantive equality of women and men

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt  a  comprehensive  strategy  to  modify  or  eliminate  patriarchal attitudes and stereotypes that discriminate against women, with special focus on women belonging to minority groups who are targets of hate speech and racially motivated  violence.  The  strategy  should  include  a  monitoring  mechanism  to assess the impact of the measures taken and design remedial action

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct  a  study  on  the  possible  impact  of  over-sexualized representations  of  girls  and  women  in  the  media  and  the  prevalence  of pornography  on  the  increase  in  gender-based  violence  against  women  in  the State party

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a holistic national strategy to address violence against women as soon as possible

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Put  in  place  effective  monitoring  mechanisms  to  regularly  evaluate the  impact of the  measures taken to combat  violence against  women and take remedial action

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Further  study  the  root  causes  for  the  low  reporting  and  conviction rates in cases of violence against women and strengthen its efforts to eliminate all barriers preventing women from reporting violence to the police

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Carry out an evaluation of the response of the police and judiciary to complaints  of  sexual  crimes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: introduce  mandatory  capacity -building  for judges,  prosecutors,  police  officers  and  other  law  enforcement  officers  on  the strict application of criminal law provisions on violence a gainst women and on gender-sensitive procedures for interviewing women victims of violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Reinforce assistance and protection provided to all women victims of violence, including by strengthening the capacity of shelters and crisis centres and  ensuring  that  they  meet  the  accommodation  needs  of  all  victims  without discrimination,  as  well  as  by  allocating  adequate  human,  technical  and financial resources

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Revise,  from  a  gender  perspective,  the  conditions  for  granting temporary  residence  permits  to   migrant  women  who  are  dependent  on  their partners  in  order  to  avoid  adverse  consequences  for  those  women  of  their dependency  on  their  partners  when  the  latter  exercise  violence  against  them and ensure full protection to women victims of violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Systematically collect disaggregated data on all forms of violence against women, protection measures, prosecutions and sentences imposed on perpetrators

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure  that  the  new  legislation  to  regulate  the  export  of  arms includes a strong and robust gender specific perspective

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue  its  pioneering  role and  innovative  approaches  in  addressing  trafficking  of  women  for  sexual exploitation, as well as its efforts to reinforce international, regional and bilateral cooperation  with  countries  of  origin,  transit  and  destination  to  prevent trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen  its  efforts  to improve  data collection on victims of trafficking, disaggregated by sex, age  and nationality,  and  ensure  adequate  protection,  rehabilitation  and  reintegration services  for  them

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure  adequate  protection,  rehabilitation  and  reintegration services  for  them (victims of trafficking)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen  the  assistance  provided  to  women  and  girls  who  wish  to  leave prostitution, including by providing alternative income -generating opportunities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take targeted measures to maintain its achievements in ensuring a high rate of representation of women in political and public life, including in the parliament, at the national, provincial  and  municipal  levels, in doing  so, the State party pay particular attention to underrepresented groups of women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen  its  strategies  to  address  discriminatory  stereotypes  and structural  barriers  that  may  deter  girls  from  enrolling  in  traditionally  male dominated  fields  of  study,  such  as  mathematics,  information  technology  and science

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Improve conditions for women to pursue research careers and ensure that they are able to benefit from research funding and postgraduate studies on equal terms with men

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in educaiton and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure  that  a  zero-tolerance  policy  on  violence  and  harassment  is effectively implemented in all schools, which should include counselling services and  effective  reporting  mechanisms

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in educaiton and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure  that  a  zero-tolerance  policy  on  violence  and  harassment  is effectively implemented in all schools, which should include awareness-raising  efforts

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in health and education
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in school curricula age-appropriate and gender-sensitive education on sexuality and women’s human rights, including sexual and reproductive health and rights

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to  combat discrimination  against disadvantaged groups  of women  and  girls  in  accessing  education

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure  effective  monitoring  and evaluation of the impact of such efforts (efforts to ensure girls have access to education), to support taking remedial action

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify  its  efforts  to ensure  equal  opportunities  for  women  in  the  labour  market,  including traditionally male-dominated sectors such as information technology and science

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: create  more  opportunities  for  women  to  gain  access  to  full -time  employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase  the  incentives  for  men  to  use  their  right  to  parental  leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take specific  and  proactive  measures  to  eliminate  occupational  segregation  and  to reduce the gender pay gap

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take into account the needs of disadvantaged groups of women (regarding occupational segregation) and consider in this regard the use of temporary special  measures such  as  financial  incentives

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ratify  the  Domestic Workers  Convention,  2011  (No.  189)  of  the International Labour Organization

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: uphold  its  due  diligence  obligations  to  ensure  that  companies  under  its jurisdiction  or  control  respect,  protect  and  fulfil  women’s  human  rights  when operating abroad

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in health and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Further  analyse  the  root  causes  for  the  increase  in  work -related illness and use of sick leave among women to adopt structural solutions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take  all  necessary measures,  including  through  judicial  training,  to  ensure  that  gender-based violence  against  women  in  the  domestic  sphere  is  taken  into  account  in decisions on child custody or visitation rights and sensitize the judiciary on the negative impact of such violence on a child’s development

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake  research  on  the economic  consequences  of  divorce  for  both  spouses,  with  specific  attention  to the enhanced human capital and earning potential of male spouses on the basis of  their  full-time  and  uninterrupted  career  patterns and review its current legislation in the light of the outcome  of  that  research  with  a  view  to  aligning  it  with  the  Committee’s general  recommendation  No.  29  (2013)  on  article  16  of  t he  Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to intensify its efforts to address the issue of violence against women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: enact comprehensive legislation against all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence, as soon as possible. Such legislation should sanction all forms of violence against women and should ensure that women and girls who are victims of violence have access to immediate means of redress and protection and that perpetrators are prosecuted and punished, but should also provide for the establishment of additional support services for victims, including shelters, as well as the provision of government funding for such services

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of training activities and programmes for parliamentarians, the judiciary and legal and public officials, in particular law enforcement personnel and health-service providers, in order to ensure that they are sensitized to all forms of violence against women and can provide adequate support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of public awareness-raising campaigns on all forms of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: standardize data and trends on the prevalence of various forms of violence, as well as on the number of complaints, investigations and prosecutions of cases

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the quick ratification of the Council of Europe Convention on Action against Trafficking in Human Beings

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: strengthen its measures to combat all forms of trafficking in women and children, including through increased international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin and transit, in line with article 6 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the prosecution and punishment of trafficking, but also the protection and recovery of victims of trafficking, including through the allocation of adequate resources to existing specialized services and the establishment of additional services in all cantons

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider the extension of temporary residency permits and other measures to be in compliance with the Recommended Principles and Guidelines on Human Rights and Human Trafficking developed by the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights in 2002

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: collect and analyse data on all aspects of trafficking, disaggregated by age and country of origin, in order to identify trends and root causes, as well as priority areas for action, and to formulate relevant policies, such information, as well as information on the impact of the measures taken to combat trafficking, be included in the State party’s next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: regularly review the visa and other regulations for cabaret dancers, and to consider including provisions that would allow women to change to a different sector of work

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take sustained legal and other measures, with benchmarks and concrete timetables, to increase the representation of women in elected and appointed positions in public life, in political parties, in the diplomatic service and in the judiciary in line with its general recommendation 23

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: introduce temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation 25 with the aim of achieving balanced representation of women and men

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase the availability of training and capacity-building programmes for women wishing to enter or already in public office and to enhance its awareness-raising campaigns on the importance of women’s full and equal participation in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to encourage the media to ensure that female and male candidates and elected representatives receive equal visibility in the media, especially during election periods

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop measures aimed at the diversification of women’s academic and professional choices, including through awareness-raising, training

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: develop measures aimed at the diversification of women’s academic and professional choices, including through counselling programmes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: monitor the career development of women in the education system to ensure equal access and prevent hidden or indirect discrimination faced by women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market, including through the use of temporary special measures, with time-bound targets, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and its general recommendation 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take proactive and concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, through, inter alia, education, training and retraining and effective enforcement mechanisms

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: job evaluation systems based on gender-sensitive criteria continue to be developed with the aim of narrowing and closing the gender pay gap

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: create more opportunities for women to access full-time employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to allow women and men to reconcile family and professional responsibilities and for the promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between men and women by providing, inter alia, more childcare facilities and paid paternity leave

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake the planned reform of the current federal taxation system in a timely manner, with a view to eliminating the burden on married couples with two incomes, and to report on progress achieved or, if relevant, on outcome in its next periodic report

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: give full attention to the economic empowerment of rural women, in particular women farmers, and ensure their access to and control over land and their access to credit facilities and training opportunities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: make use of the findings of the study published in June 2007 by the Federal Commission on Women’s Issues on the effects of the new divorce law, and to accord serious consideration to recommendations issued by the Commission, in order to better redress gender disparities and economic disparities upon divorce

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: be proactive in its measures, including through the development of targeted programmes and strategies, to increase women’s awareness of and access to education, health and social services, training and employment, as well as to familiarize them with their rights to gender equality and non-discrimination

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: With respect to article 287 of the Penal Code, the Committee reiterates its previous recommendation that consent of the women be made a prerequisite for genital examinations under all circumstances

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: undertake studies to evaluate the impact of the ban on wearing headscarves in the fields of education, employment, health and political and public life, and to include detailed information regarding the result of the study and measures taken to eliminate any discriminatory consequences of the ban in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to accord priority attention to the adoption of comprehensive measures to address violence against women in accordance with its general recommendation No. 19

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: evaluate and strengthen Law No. 4320 in order to enact comprehensive legislation on all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence, and to ensure that in such legislation all forms of violence against women are prohibited, that women and girls who are victims of violence have access to immediate means of redress and protection, including protection orders, and that perpetrators are prosecuted and punished

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of training activities and programmes for public officials, the judiciary, law enforcement personnel and health-service providers in order to ensure that they can address and combat all forms of violence against women and can provide adequate support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continuation of public awareness-raising campaigns on all forms of violence against women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: establish additional counselling and other support services for victims of violence, including additional shelters, and ensure that adequate resources are allocated in order to implement the necessary measures in this regard

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to enhance its cooperation with non-governmental organizations working in the area of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: honour killings be explicitly included within the scope of article 82 of the Penal Code and classified as aggravated homicide, and that such crimes are treated as seriously as other violent crimes with regard to investigation and prosecution

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implementation of effective prevention measures, including educational and awareness-raising measures aimed at law enforcement officials, the judiciary, health-service providers, social workers, community leaders and the general public (regarding honor crimes)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include detailed information on the incidence of killings in the name of honour, particularly in rural or remote areas, including the number of investigations, prosecutions and perpetrators punished, as well as the sentences imposed

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to continue to take all appropriate measures to combat all forms of trafficking in women and children in line with article 6 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: urges the State party to ensure the quality implementation of the Second National Action Plan

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provision of adequate comprehensive support services, including shelters, to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase its efforts at international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination in order to prevent trafficking, to bring perpetrators to justice and to improve reintegration programmes to prevent victimization and revictimization

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures, with benchmarks and concrete timetables, to increase the number of women in political and public life, at all levels and in all areas, in light of its general recommendation No. 23

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: introduce temporary special measures, including quotas, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and its general recommendation No. 25, to strengthen its efforts to promote women to positions of leadership

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to increase the availability of training and capacity-building programmes for women wishing to enter or already in public office and to enhance its awareness-raising campaigns aimed at both women and men on the importance of women’s participation in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to review and assess systematically the impact of such measures (to ensure equality in political and public life)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take proactive measures to decrease the female illiteracy rate, including through the adoption of comprehensive programmes of formal and non-formal education and through adult education and training

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: address the persisting disparity between boys and girls in education, including through the implementation of measures to ensure equal access for girls and women to all levels of education, and to ensure retention of girls in school, particularly in rural areas

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include the use of temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase measures aimed at the diversification of women’s academic and professional choices, including through awareness-raising, training

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase measures aimed at the diversification of women’s academic and professional choices, including through counselling programmes

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take measures to eliminate traditional attitudes that perpetuate discrimination and non-compliance with the provisions of article 10 of the Convention, to address regional disparities in the quality of education and to implement further targeted policies and programmes to overcome educational disadvantages faced by girls and women belonging to diverse ethnic groups, particularly Kurdish girls and women, and those whose mother tongue is not Turkish

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: inclusion of information and data on the situation of those groups (minorities) in the next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market, including through the use of temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and its general recommendation No. 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take proactive and concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, through, inter alia, education, training and retraining and effective enforcement mechanisms, and to narrow and close the pay gap

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: pay particular attention to the conditions of women workers in the informal sector and to unpaid family workers with a view to ensuring their access to social services and social security

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: improve its legislation banning discrimination within recruitment to employment in order to ensure its effectiveness

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide in its next report detailed information about the measures taken, including the implementation of a Prime Ministry Circular on increasing women’s employment and achieving equal opportunity, and their impact on realizing equal opportunities for women

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health and violence against women for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue efforts to improve the situation of rural women, through legislative measures and practical measures

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health and violence against women for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that all policies and programmes aimed at promoting gender equality, including those with regard to health, education, employment and the elimination of violence against women, reach the rural areas and are fully implemented at all levels

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health and violence against women for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take effective measures to eliminate discrimination against women of ethnic and minority communities, migrant women and women asylum-seekers, elderly women, as well as women with disabilities, both in society at large and within their communities, particularly in the areas of education, health, employment and political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, and health for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: be proactive in its measures, including through the development of targeted programmes and strategies, to increase women’s awareness of and access to education, health and social services, training and employment, as well as to familiarize them with their rights to gender equality and non-discrimination

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, and health for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its next report comprehensive information on the situation of Kurdish women and girls, including data on their educational opportunities and achievements, access to employment and health-care services and participation in public life and decision-making

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider the impact of the lack of retroactive applicability of the 2002 amendment to the Civil Code regarding joint ownership of acquired property on women married prior to its entry into force

documenttype: Communication No. 28/2010
recommendation: Take measures to ensure that article 5 of the Labour Act and the Convention are implemented in practice by relevant national tribunals and other public institutions in order to provide for effective protection of women against any act of gender-based discrimination in employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: intensify its efforts to overcome persistent stereotypes that are discriminatory against women, including through awareness-raising campaigns emphasizing the equal status and responsibilities of women and men in the private and public spheres through human rights education, the training of teaching staff with respect to gender equality and the revision of educational textbooks to eliminate gender stereotypes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement the Prevention of Domestic Violence Act (2001) effectively and to monitor its impact on women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: work towards a comprehensive approach to preventing and addressing all forms of violence against women, in conformity with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 19

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: improve its research and data collection on the prevalence, causes and consequences of violence against women and to include the results in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take the necessary measures to ensure effective penalties in the cases of domestic violence, which are specifically targeted on perpetrators

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all necessary measures to ensure that women who are victims of domestic violence, including rural women and vulnerable groups of women, such as Roma women, have full access to the shelters and social centres for victims and to immediate means of redress and protection, without limitation of age or of another kind

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that public officials, especially law enforcement personnel, the judiciary, health-care providers and social workers, are fully familiar with the Prevention of Domestic Violence Act (2001) and knowledgeable about the other forms of violence against women, in order to be able to provide adequate assistance to the victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: address the root causes of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accelerate adoption of legislation on trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide sufficient funding for the effective implementation of the State Programme for the Prevention of Trafficking in Persons in Ukraine and of other measures aimed at combating human trafficking and to regularly monitor their impact

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take all appropriate measures, including allocating sufficient funding and establishing additional shelters for the rehabilitation and social integration of women and girl victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure a systematic investigation, prosecution and punishment of traffickers, including through enhanced international cooperation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide information about the number of victims (trafficking) as well as the number of investigations and their outcome

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take measures to increase the representation of women in elected and appointed bodies through, inter alia, the implementation of temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25, in order to realize women’s right to equal participation in all areas of public life, particularly at high levels of decision-making

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accelerate the adoption of legislative initiatives for ensuring equal opportunities for women and men in the electoral process and in the composition of the Parliament, such as Bill No. 1232, introduced in 2007

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take appropriate measures to ensure full compliance with the provisions of the Convention and guarantee real enjoyment by women on an equal footing with men of their right to equal pay for equal work

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: reduce gender-based occupational segregation and provide appropriate sanctions to eliminate sexual harassment at the workplace and other discriminatory practices

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: improve the availability and affordability of childcare facilities to help women exercise their right to work

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: assess the impact of domestic economic reforms and of the international financial and economic crisis on women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: counter the negative effects on women (of economic reforms) through adequate measures and sufficient funding and inform the Committee thereof in its next report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: use a gender-sensitive approach with respect to all poverty alleviation programmes and strategies and take into account the particular needs of women belonging to vulnerable groups

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the minimum age of marriage is raised to 18 for girls, and that no exceptions to this minimum age exist, in line with article 16 of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 21

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to take necessary legislative measures to recognize intangible property, such as pension funds, as part of marital property

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide comprehensive information and statistical data, in its next periodic report, on the situation of migrant and refugee women and of other vulnerable groups of women, in particular Roma women, who may be subjected to multiple forms of discrimination on the grounds of sex and gender, race or ethnic origin, disability, age or sexuality, and on the measures taken for eliminating discrimination against these women with regard to their access to health, education, employment, social benefits, etc

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: to ensure the full implementation of the Forced Marriage (Civil Protection) Act (2007) and to utilize existing criminal measures to address this phenomenon

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: full implementation and wider dissemination of the guidelines on forced marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of public awareness-raising campaigns targeted in particular at communities most at risk (of forced marriages)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: establishment of additional counselling and other support services for victims, including shelters, and requests the State party to enhance its cooperation with and support for non-governmental organizations working in this area (forced marriages)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: assess the impact of the minimum age limit for overseas spouses or fiancés on the prevention of forced marriage and to review its policy in this regard

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the full implementation of legislation to prohibit female genital mutilation, including prosecution of perpetrators, with a view to eliminating this harmful traditional practice

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of training activities and programmes for public officials, in particular law enforcement personnel and health-service providers, as well as the British Medical Association, so as to ensure that they are sensitized to the issue (FGM) and can provide adequate support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase its efforts to design and implement targeted prevention strategies (for FGM), as well as education and awareness‑raising programmes involving community and religious leaders, women’s organizations and the general public

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: accord priority attention to the adoption of comprehensive measures to address violence against women in accordance with its general recommendation No. 19 on violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the full implementation of legislation on violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the prosecution and conviction of perpetrators (of violence against women)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt and implement a unified and multifaceted national strategy to eliminate violence against women and girls, which would include legal, education, financial and social components

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of training activities and programmes for parliamentarians, the judiciary and public officials, in particular law enforcement personnel and health-service providers, so as to ensure that they are sensitized to all forms of violence against women and can provide adequate support to victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expansion of public awareness-raising campaigns on all forms of violence against women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: the establishment of additional counselling and other support services for victims of violence, including shelters, and requests the State party to enhance its cooperation with and support, in particular adequate and sustained funding support, for NGOs working in the area of violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: include in its legislation the prohibition of corporal punishment of children in the home

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take all appropriate measures to combat all forms of trafficking in women and children in line with article 6 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: not only to address criminal justice measures and the prosecution of traffickers but also the protection and rehabilitation of victims of trafficking victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the provision of adequate support services to victims, including those who do not cooperate with the authorities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: give consideration to granting victims of trafficking indefinite leave to remain

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase its efforts at international, regional and bilateral cooperation with countries of origin, transit and destination in order to prevent trafficking, to bring perpetrators to justice and to improve reintegration programmes to prevent victimization

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
