recommendation: take measures, with benchmarks and concrete timetables, to increase the number of women in political and public life, at all levels and in all areas, in the light of its general recommendation No. 23 on women in political and public life

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: party introduce temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and general recommendation No. 25, to strengthen its efforts to promote women to positions of leadership

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase the availability of training and capacity-building programmes for women wishing to enter or already in public office and to enhance its awareness-raising campaigns on the importance of women’s participation in political and public life

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt appropriate measures to guarantee the implementation of all the provisions of article 11 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market, including through the use of temporary special measures in accordance with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take proactive and concrete measures to eliminate occupational segregation and to close the pay gap between women and men, including through the introduction of mandatory pay audits

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts to assist women and men to reconcile family and professional responsibilities and for its promotion of equal sharing of domestic and family tasks by providing, inter alia, more and improved childcare facilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: encourage men to share responsibility for childcare, including through awareness-raising activities and by taking parental leave

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: study the effect of the application of the Family Law Act (1996) on the economic situation of women upon divorce and to assess the effectiveness of current regulations in protecting the property rights of women upon the break-up of marriage or of de facto unions - include information on the research undertaken in this regard, as well as the results, in its next periodic report

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take effective measures to increase the participation of ethnic and minority women in the labour market, as well as in political and public life, including through the use of temporary special measures in line with article 4, paragraph 1, of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education and health for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct regular and comprehensive studies on intersectional discrimination against ethnic minority women, to collect statistics on their situation in employment, education, health and public life and to submit such information in its next periodic report

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: review its “no recourse to public funds” policy to ensure the protection of and provision of support to victims of violence (for migrants, refugees, and asylum seekers)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: mitigate the impact of austerity measures on women and the services provided to women, especially women with disabilities and older women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that spending reviews continuously focus on measuring and balancing the impact of austerity measures on women’s rights

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: further review the policy of commissioning services wherever this may undermine the provision of specialized services for women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure effective access by women, in particular women victims of violence, to courts and tribunals

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider implementing the recommendations made by Lord Carloway regarding the removal of the corroboration requirement in criminal cases relating to sexual offences

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: extend the limitation period for filing civil claims involving sexual abuse, especially of girls, so that victims can still initiate proceedings when they are adults

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: evaluate the impact of the Voluntary Search Code

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: consider using more prescriptive temporary special measures to improve the representation of women in the public and private sectors, in particular on company boards, and in political life

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ratify the Istanbul Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: criminalize forced marriage

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase its efforts to protect women, including black and ethnic minority women, against all forms of violence, including domestic violence, and so-called “honour killings”;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue public campaigns to raise awareness of all forms of violence against women, including black and ethnic minority women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: step up efforts to train police officers in order to eliminate prejudices concerning the credibility of victims of domestic violence

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: revise its legislation to prohibit corporal punishment of children in the home

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the full implementation of its legislation on female genital mutilation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the Crown Prosecution Service is provided with the support necessary to effectively prosecute perpetrators of this offence, including by supporting the action plan on improving prosecutions for female genital mutilation released by the Director of Public Prosecutions in November 2012

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt a comprehensive national framework to combat trafficking in women and girls

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: identify any weaknesses in the National Referral Mechanism (related to trafficking)

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that victims of trafficking are properly identified and adequately supported and protected

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: revise its legislation by shifting the burden of proof from the prosecution to the purchaser of sexual services

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: once the prosecution proves that the child was over 13 years of age and under 18 years of age, and that the accused purchased sexual services from the child, the purchaser should be required to establish that he or she did not reasonably believe that the child was under 18 years of age

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life for minorities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to take specific targeted measures to improve the representation of women, in particular black and ethnic minority women and women with disabilities, in Parliament and the judiciary

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in political and public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the participation of women in the post-conflict process in Northern Ireland, in line with Security Council resolution 1325

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Enhance measures to prevent, punish and eradicate all forms of violence against women and girls, including bullying and expressions of racist sentiments, in educational institutions

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Step up career guidance activities to encourage girls to pursue non‑traditional paths and improve the gender awareness of teaching personnel at all levels of the education system

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take coordinated measures to encourage increased participation by girls in science, technology, engineering and mathematics, and in apprenticeships

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take appropriate measures to collect data on women in positions at all levels of academic institutions and improve the representation of women at the upper echelons

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Step up its efforts to promote the use of flexible working arrangements

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: introduce shared parental leave to encourage men to participate equally in childcare responsibilities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to take proactive and specific measures to eliminate occupational segregation and to narrow the gender pay gap

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create greater opportunities for women with disabilities to gain access to employment

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Assess the effectiveness of the voluntary reporting initiative under the Think, Act, Report framework, so as to ensure transparency of salaries in enterprises

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure access by women to justice in employment-related cases, including those pertaining to discrimination on the grounds of pregnancy and motherhood

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: provide affordable childcare and to mitigate the impact of the proposed reforms of the welfare system on the costs of childcare for low-income families and the increased burden of care that this places on women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Extend the concession under the “no recourse to public funds” policy to all women who are subjected to gender-based violence and exploitation

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue to provide training on gender-sensitive approaches in the treatment of victims of violence to officers who are in charge of immigration and asylum applications

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: take targeted measures to facilitate the access of black and ethnic minority women to the labour market in order to alleviate their concentration in low-paid jobs

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment, education, health for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Step up its efforts to eliminate discrimination against ethnic minority women and improve access to social services, including health care, education and employment

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt measures to prevent the potential exploitation of the Universal Credit system by an abusive male spouse

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economy and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: expedite efforts to undertake reforms with a view to protecting the property rights of women upon the breakdown of marriage or of de facto unions, in line with general recommendation No. 29, on the economic consequences of marriage, family relations and their dissolution, and article 16 of the Convention

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure women’s unhindered access to justice systems, including by raising the awareness of the public in general, and women who are victims of discrimination and gender-based violence in particular, about existing laws and mechanisms to obtain free legal assistance, enabling them to file claims about violations of their rights;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide, in its next periodic report, information on the implementation and impact of the first midterm gender budgeting programme, as well as detailed information on the implementation of its Strategy for Gender Equality and Reduction of Gender-based Violence and Domestic Violence 2011-2015, including information on the remaining challenges;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee recommends that the State party continue its efforts, including awareness-raising, to address gender stereotypes that perpetuate discrimination against women by developing a wide-ranging strategy across all sectors to eliminate discriminatory stereotypes and promote positive non-stereotyped images of women.

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in marital and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: With reference to joint general recommendation No. 31 of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women/general comment No. 18 of the Committee on the Rights of the Child on harmful practices (2014), the Committee also recommends that the State party prohibit all harmful practices, including child marriage, the practice of families choosing husbands as well as killings or other crimes committed in the name of so-called “honour”, and prosecute and adequately punish the perpetrators of such practices.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to encourage women to report cases of gender-based violence by providing free legal aid, including in rural and remote areas, and by establishing a 24-hour hotline service;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen the role and capacity of relevant authorities with regard to the protection and rehabilitation of victims of gender-based violence in accordance with international standards

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the number and capacity of State-run shelters,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: increase the financing of shelters run by non-governmental organizations and put in place mechanisms for contracting, delegating to or obtaining the services of non-governmental organizations in order to respond to the needs of all women who are victims of gender-based violence, including Roma and Egyptian women, women with disabilities and women living in rural and remote areas;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen the enforcement of court decisions, in particular those that concern protection orders or emergency protection orders for women who are victims of gender-based violence, including by building the capacity of judicial personnel, such as court bailiffs.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensuring the investigation, prosecution and conviction of traffickers, and of public officials complicit in such crimes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Building the capacity of the border and migration police to detect victims of trafficking

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Exempting victims of trafficking from any liability and providing them with adequate protection, such as witness protection programmes and temporary residence permits, irrespective of their ability or willingness to cooperate with the prosecutorial authorities

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Funding mobile units operated by civil society groups for the purpose of identifying victims

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increasing funding for shelters, both those run by the State and those run by non-governmental organizations, in order to provide victims with medical, psychological and social reintegration services.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Enforcing the statutory quotas in the Electoral Code and the Gender Equality Law for the next political elections, and applying sanctions to political parties for failure to meet those quotas;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and private sphere
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Monitoring the implementation of the temporary special measures provided for under the Gender Equality Law regarding the participation of women in decision-making bodies at the central and local levels in both the public and private sectors, in order to meet the targets established in the law;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promoting the participation in political and public life of women belonging to disadvantaged or marginalized groups, such as Roma and Egyptian women and women with disabilities;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Removing any obstacles, such as civil registration requirements or physical barriers, to enable women to exercise their right to political and public participation, including the right to vote.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women/girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: continue its efforts aimed at reducing the dropout rates among girls, especially Roma and Egyptian girls,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee also recommends that the State party encourage young women to choose non-traditional fields of study and career paths that are traditionally male-dominated.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Improve its statistical analysis to cover all areas, including the informal sector, in which women are concentrated,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and improve the labour and social protection of women working in the informal sector, in particular in the textile and shoe industries;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to better estimate and reduce the gender wage gap, in particular in the private sector, by implementing effectively the principle of equal pay for work of equal value, and increase the minimum wage;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure equal access to the formal labour market for women belonging to linguistic and ethnic minorities and women with disabilities, including by introducing temporary special measures in line with article 4 (1) of the Convention.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: implement a comprehensive strategy to ensure that rural women and girls and women and girls living in remote areas have as equal access as their urban counterparts to high-quality education, employment and health care, as well as to decision-making processes and economic empowerment;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take measures to change traditional perceptions about the roles of women and girls in the family and in society, to counter growing patriarchal attitudes in rural areas;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt targeted laws, policies and programmes to ensure equal rights for women belonging to disadvantaged and marginalized groups, such as Roma and Egyptian women, by improving their access to education, health services, employment and housing;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strictly prohibit child marriage, allowing only very limited and clearly defined exceptions where the courts may authorize unions under 18 years of age with the consent of both partners, criminalize violations of that prohibition,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and raise awareness among children, parents, community and religious leaders and the general public of the negative impact of child marriage on the health and development of children, in particular girls;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Reverse the burden of proof in cases of alleged sex-based or gender-based discrimination in favour of claimants

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Encourage reporting of violations of women’s human rights, such as sex-and gender-based discrimination and violence against women, to the relevant judicial and quasi-judicial bodies, including by identifying referral pathways at the national, regional and local levels and raising awareness among women and responsible State officials of these pathways;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Raise public awareness of the concept of gender, the principle of equality between women and men and the need to eliminate gender stereotypes, and ensure that the media promote positive images of women as active participants in social, economic and political life;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Introduce mandatory education on gender equality, women’s rights and gender-based violence in school curricula at the primary and secondary levels, as well as in legal training;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to review all school textbooks to eliminate discriminatory gender stereotypes, in line with the Committee’s previous concluding observations (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 31);

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite the adoption of a comprehensive law specifically criminalizing gender-based violence against women, including femicide and marital rape, in line with its general recommendation No. 19 and previous recommendations (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 23), which employs a victim-centred approach, provides for civil and criminal remedies, defines the body responsible for the implementation of the law and guarantees access to immediate means of redress and protection, including protection orders;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ratify the Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the availability of a sufficient number of adequate shelters in all regions of the State party and that victims receive counselling, rehabilitation and support services for their reintegration into society;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide capacity-building for the judiciary, the police and law enforcement personnel and health-service providers on a zero-tolerance and gender-sensitive approach to dealing with cases of gender-based violence and providing assistance to victims;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Allocate adequate human, technical and financial resources to the recently established special police division to address gender-based and sexual violence against women and children;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Systematically collect statistical data on gender-based violence, disaggregated by sex, age, ethnic origin and relationship between the perpetrator and the victim, and include such data in its next periodic report;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take effective measures to prevent gender-based violence against women, such as femicide and marital rape, study the phenomenon and guarantee that criminal charges are brought against perpetrators.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: study the phenomenon [of gender-based violence against women]

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: guarantee that criminal charges are brought against perpetrators [of gender-based violence against women]

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a comprehensive State policy to address the issue of trafficking in persons and exploitation of prostitution of women and girls;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen mechanisms for the investigation, prosecution and punishment of trafficking offenders, as well as victim and witness protection programmes, and ensure sufficient consultation of victims during prosecutions;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Train judges, prosecutors, police officers and immigration officers on the strict application of criminal law provisions to prosecute traffickers, as well as on gender-sensitive ways to approach victims of trafficking;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Integrate disaggregated statistical data on the extent of various types of exploitation of prostitution and trafficking and on the countries of origin, as well as destination, of victims of trafficking, into the next periodic report;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Further expand funding of shelters for victims of trafficking, in line with the Committee’s previous recommendations (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 25);

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Allocate sufficient resources for rehabilitation and reintegration programmes for victims of trafficking and exit programmes for women wishing to leave prostitution, including by providing alternative income-generating opportunities;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide financial and other forms of support to civil society organizations assisting women who are victims of trafficking and exploitation of prostitution in order to facilitate their rehabilitation and reintegration;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify efforts aimed at bilateral, regional and international cooperation to prevent trafficking, including by exchanging information and harmonizing legal procedures to prosecute traffickers, with countries of origin, transit and destination, particularly countries in the region;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Suspend the imposition of administrative fines on women in prostitution and reinforce preventive measures to discourage the demand for prostitution.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt measures, including temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4 (1) of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendations No. 25 (2004) on temporary special measures and No. 23 (1997) on women in public life, in order to accelerate the full and equal participation of women in elected and appointed bodies, including in the National Assembly, ministerial positions, regional and local municipalities, the judiciary and the foreign service;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Introduce a gender parity system for appointments and accelerated recruitment of women into senior positions in the public and private sectors;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Implement national campaigns to raise awareness about the importance of the participation of women in public and political life, specifically in rural areas, in line with its previous recommendation (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 29);

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the availability of training and capacity-building programmes for women wishing to enter political life or hold public office

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and continue to encourage the media to ensure that female and male candidates and elected representatives receive equal visibility in the media, especially during election periods;

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and political/public life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the safety of women in political life, in line with the previous recommendations of the Committee (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 29).

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: To strengthen strategies to address discriminatory stereotypes and structural barriers that may deter girls from enrolling in traditionally male- dominated fields of study, such as mathematics, information technology and science;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: To ensure that girls and women who have dropped out of school are readmitted to the education system in age-appropriate classroom environments and that they have access to technical and vocational training opportunities facilitating their professional reinsertion, in line with the Committee’s previous recommendations (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 31).

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Apply the principle of equal pay for work of equal value, as well as gender-neutral analytical job classification, evaluation methods and regular pay surveys, in line with the Committee’s previous recommendations (CEDAW/C/ARM/CO/4/Rev.1, para. 33);

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Abolish the list of jobs and professions considered dangerous for women, minors and people with limited capabilities for work, contained in decision No. 2308-N of 29 December 2005;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to formal employment, including by promoting the equal sharing of domestic and family responsibilities between men and women,

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to formal employment, including by providing sufficient and adequate childcare facilities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to formal employment, including by strengthening incentives for men to exercise their right to parental leave,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: adopt a time-bound plan to implement the Transition from the Informal to the Formal Economy Recommendation, 2015 (No. 204), of the International Labour Organization, with a view to facilitating women’s access to the formal economy;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide a regulatory framework for the informal sector and ensure that women in this sector have access to social protection, maternity protection and childcare support;

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt legislation to define and prohibit sexual harassment in the workplace

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Reinforce measures to expand women’s access to microfinance and microcredit at low interest rates, enabling women to engage in income- generating activities and to start their own businesses;

womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Develop a confidential and safe system for filing complaints relating to gender-based discrimination and sexual harassment in the workplace, and ensure that victims have effective access to such means of redress.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Implement the newly adopted law to eradicate the practice of sex-selection abortion

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that the practice of sex-selective abortion is immediately halted through measures such as broader gender equitable policies and support for families with girls, as suggested in the 2012 study entitled Sex Imbalances at Birth: Current Trends, Consequences and Policy Implications, conducted on the initiative of the Ministry of Health.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that rural women participate in decision-making processes, including community decision-making processes and development planning;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Guarantee the access of rural women to economic opportunities, including income-generating projects and credit facilities, on an equal and equitable basis with men and with their urban counterparts;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address the specific needs of women affected by the conflict in terms of access to education, health and economic opportunities, in line with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 30 (2013) on women in conflict prevention, conflict and post-conflict situations;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: fully involve women in all stages of the peace process;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Finalize and adopt the national action plan to implement Security Council resolution 1325 (2000) on women and peace and security, in cooperation with women’s organizations,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and take into consideration the full spectrum of the Council’s women and peace and security agenda as reflected in the above-mentioned Council resolutions.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality for women with disabilities
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a specific budget to promote the access of women with disabilities to education, employment, health care, social life and decision- making processes;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collect, analyse and include specific data on violence against women with disabilities in its next periodic report.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for migrant women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide income-generating opportunities for returnee Armenian migrant women;

womensrightsissue: Violence against migrant and asylum seeking women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure an appropriate number of reception facilities for migrants and asylum seekers, allowing for safe accommodation of women;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee recommends that the State party take all appropriate measures, including temporary special measures, where needed, to combat all forms of discrimination against women belonging to ethnic minorities so as to ensure their equal access to justice, education, health, social security and social services, housing and employment.

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in marital and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Include in the next periodic report statistical data, disaggregated by sex and ethnicity, on the exceptions that have been approved for the celebration of marriage before 18 years of age;

womensrightsissue: Violence against women in marital and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Remove the possibility of approving exceptions to the minimum age of marriage at 18 years, in accordance with article 16 of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 21 (2009) on the right of everyone to take part in cultural life;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the legal protection of the economic rights of women in de facto unions, and of the children resulting from such unions, in accordance with the Committee’s general recommendation No. 29 (2013) on the economic consequences of marriage, family relations and their dissolution.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address discriminatory stereotypes regarding the roles and responsibilities of women and men in the family and in society, with the involvement of women’s and civil society organizations, and increase the resources dedicated to such efforts;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct regular awareness-raising and media campaigns on intersecting forms of discrimination faced by women on the basis of all grounds covered by the Gender Equality Act and the Equal Treatment Act.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Establish an effective strategy to prevent domestic violence,

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: as well as a multisectoral national referral mechanism involving judges, local police, social and health workers and other stakeholders for victims of domestic violence;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend the Penal Code to review the definition of rape as any non-consensual sexual act irrespective of pain, physical abuse and/or damage to health and threat, to specifically criminalize sexual harassment and to add economic and psychological violence to the definition of domestic violence;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen the enforcement of court decisions, in particular those that concern protection orders or emergency protection orders for women who are victims of gender-based violence, including by providing capacity-building for judges and court bailiffs;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women in marital and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Amend the Family Law Act to ensure that the occurrence of domestic violence is always taken into consideration in determining custody of children,

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women in marital and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: train child protection agencies on domestic violence

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women in marital and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and ensure that experts on violence against women are heard in child custody proceedings;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Expedite the ratification of the Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensuring that cases of trafficking are effectively investigated and the perpetrators prosecuted and adequately punished;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Providing capacity-building for law enforcement officials on early identification and referral of victims of trafficking;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increasing funding for both State-run and NGO-run shelters and medical, psychological and social reintegration services for victims of trafficking;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthening the gender-sensitivity of support services for victims of trafficking and of witness protection programmes;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Collecting data on trafficking in women and girls and exploitation of prostitution

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and strengthening assistance provided to women and girls who wish to leave prostitution, including by providing alternative income- generating opportunities.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: In line with its general recommendation No. 23 (1997) on women in political and public life, the Committee recommends that the State party adopt targeted measures, including temporary special measures, in accordance with article 4 (1) of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25 (2004), such as statutory quotas and a zipper system for elections at the national and local levels, ensuring the appointment of an equal number of women and men to leadership positions in the Government, local administrative bodies, the judiciary and State-owned companies, in order to increase the participation of women, in particular rural women, women from ethnic and linguistic minorities and women with disabilities, in political and public life.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen its strategies to address discriminatory stereotypes and structural barriers that may deter girls from enrolling in traditionally male- dominated fields of study, such as information technology and architecture;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review school curricula and textbooks at all levels of education to eliminate discriminatory gender stereotypes;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt targeted measures, including temporary special measures, in line with article 4 (1), of the Convention and the Committee’s general recommendation No. 25 (2004), and set clear targets and time frames for promoting the recruitment of women professors and women in decision-making positions in educational institutions;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women/girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that girls belonging to linguistic and ethnic minorities, in particular Russian girls, and girls with disabilities, have adequate access to education, including instruction in or of their mother tongue and inclusive education, respectively.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against women and gender equality in employment
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Establish an effective mechanism for bringing complaints about sexual harassment in the workplace to allow for cases to be taken to the court by the Labour Inspectorate or/and the Gender Equality and Equal Treatment Commissioner ex officio;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen measures to address horizontal and vertical occupational segregation

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and amend the Gender Equality Act to mandate the Labour Inspectorate to monitor the implementation of the principle of equal pay for work of equal value;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen the collection, analysis and publication of sex-segregated statistical data on employment, including court data on the enforcement of the Gender Equality Act;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the representation of women in management positions in private companies, including through temporary special measures;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Introduce effective sanctions against employers who violate the Gender Equality Act;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Allocate a specific budget to the implementation of the Welfare Development Plan 2016-2023 with a view to reducing the disproportionate burden of care work on women and facilitating access to paternity leave for men;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promote employment of women in the 25-49 age group by providing sufficient childcare services and encouraging men to take paternity leave;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address employment discrimination against women returning to work after maternity leave;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for minority women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Promote access to the labour market for women belonging to the Russian-speaking minority, women with disabilities and lesbian, bisexual, transgender and intersex women by addressing discrimination and social stigma against them.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that eligibility criteria for start-up programmes, microcredit schemes and entrepreneurship programmes take into account the specific needs of women;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Implement a comprehensive strategy to ensure that rural women and girls have adequate access to high quality education, employment and health care, as well as to decision-making processes and economic empowerment;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life for rural women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen the involvement of women’s organizations in rural policy planning.

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: establish measures for the identification and prevention of and response to sexual and gender-based violence in the reception centres for asylum seekers;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Violence against and gender equality for women asylum seekers
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Allocate additional resources for ensuring an adequate standard of living for asylum seekers, in particular single women and single mothers, and for measures to prevent and combat sexual and gender-based violence against such women;

reportconsidered: Combined fifth and sixth periodic reports
womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Review its current legal regime governing marriage and family relations, with a view to extending the existing legal protection to women living in de facto unions, in line with the Committee’s general recommendation 29 (2013) on the economic consequences of marriage, family relations and their dissolution;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Implement the recommendations of the Defender of Rights on the introduction of a clear and precise definition of sexual harassment in the draft law on equality and citizenship and on the inclusion of legal provisions in the draft law on the modernization of justice in the twenty-first century allowing for a civil remedy in cases of sexual harassment committed outside the workplace, providing also for an adjustment of the burden of proof;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee recommends that the State party use temporary special measures to address the urgent needs of women belonging to disadvantaged groups in fields such as political life, education, employment and health.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a comprehensive strategy to modify or eliminate patriarchal attitudes and stereotypes that discriminate against women, with particular focus on women belonging to minority groups, who are often the target of hate speech and racially motivated violence. The strategy should include monitoring to assess the impact of the measures taken and facilitate the design of remedial action to ensure their social integration;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Combat all forms of discrimination against women and girls belonging to racial, ethnic, national and religious minorities, including those living in sensitive urban areas, to ensure their equal access to health care and education, employment, housing and the public and political arenas and to reinforce the willingness and capacity to live together in harmony (le vivre- ensemble);

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Engage with relevant actors and use innovative measures, including by imposing stricter regulations when possible, to enhance a positive and non-stereotypical portrayal of women in the media and in advertisements;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct a study on the possible impact of oversexualized representations of girls and women in the media and the prevalence of pornography on the increase in gender-based violence against women in the State party;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Further study the root causes of the low reporting and conviction rates in cases of gender-based violence against women

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and strengthen its efforts to eliminate all barriers preventing women from reporting violence to the police;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen monitoring mechanisms to regularly evaluate the impact of the measures taken to combat gender-based violence against women and take remedial action;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Evaluate the response of the police and judiciary to complaints of sexual crimes

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: and introduce mandatory capacity-building for judges, prosecutors, police officers and other law enforcement officers on the strict application of criminal law provisions on gender-based violence against women and on gender-sensitive procedures for interviewing women who are victims of violence;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Reinforce the assistance and protection provided to women who are victims of violence, including by strengthening the capacity of shelters and crisis centres and ensuring that they meet the accommodation needs of all victims without discrimination and by allocating adequate human, technical and financial resources;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Revise, from a gender perspective, the conditions for granting temporary residence permits to migrant women who are dependent on their abusive partners;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Allocate sufficient human, technical and financial resources to the Interministerial Mission for the Protection of Women Victims of Violence and for Combating Human Trafficking to allow it to fulfil its mandate.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee recommends that the State party review its approach to extraterritorial prosecution of acts of gender-based violence against women, including female genital mutilation and forced and/or child marriage, and ensure that such offences, when perpetrated by French nationals or permanent residents, are prosecuted ex officio in the State party, regardless of whether the particular offence is criminalized in the country in which it is committed.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Investigate, prosecute and punish all cases of trafficking in persons, especially women and girls, and ensure that the sentences imposed on perpetrators are commensurate with the gravity of the crime;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen measures to identify and provide support to women at risk of trafficking, in particular minors;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Improve access to data on victims of trafficking, disaggregated by sex and age;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Prevent and combat other forms of exploitative practices related to trafficking, in particular forced labour, servitude and slavery;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the human, technical and financial resources of the Interministerial Mission for the Protection of Women Victims of Violence and for Combating Human Trafficking and the National Consultative Commission for Human Rights to ensure the effective coordination, monitoring and assessment of government action against trafficking in persons and exploitation;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Provide victims of trafficking with adequate access to health care and counselling and strengthen such services by providing enhanced human, technical and financial resources to social work centres and targeted training for social workers;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that all victims of trafficking, irrespective of their ethnic, national or social background, obtain effective protection and redress, including rehabilitation and compensation;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Plan the evaluation, within three years, of the impact of Act No. 2016-444, including on the type and extent of prostitution and trafficking, social perceptions of prostitution, the purchase of sexual services and women who engage in prostitution;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Increase the budget and strengthen the assistance provided to women and girls who wish to leave prostitution, including by providing alternative income-generating opportunities.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Evaluate the impact of the penalties currently applied with respect to elections to the National Assembly and the Senate and, if necessary, adopt stronger measures, including a revision of the electoral system;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Pursue its efforts to ensure equal representation in decision-making positions on boards of directors and in various areas of public administration;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in public and political life
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify awareness-raising campaigns for politicians, journalists, teachers and the general public, to enhance the understanding that the full, equal, free and democratic participation of women on an equal basis with men in political and public life is a requirement for the full implementation of the human rights of women.

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for minority women/girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Mandate a comprehensive study to determine the impact of Act No. 2004-228 banning the wearing of religious symbols in schools on the right to education of girls (see CEDAW/C/FRA/CO/6, para. 20) and their inclusion in all facets of French society as full members of the community, and indicate remedies, if needed;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Strengthen its strategies to address discriminatory stereotypes and structural barriers that may deter girls from enrolling in traditionally male- dominated fields of study, such as mathematics, information technology and science;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education and violence against women/girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure that a zero-tolerance policy on violence and harassment that includes counselling services, awareness-raising efforts and effective reporting mechanisms is effectively implemented in all schools;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for disadvantaged women/girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to combat discrimination against disadvantaged groups of women and girls in gaining access to high-quality education, including by adopting temporary special measures,

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in education for disadvantaged women/girls
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure the effective monitoring and evaluation of the impact of such efforts, to inform remedial action. [efforts to combat discriminatin against disadvantaged groups of women and girls in gaining access to high-quality education]

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt effective measures, including skills training, incentives for and encouragement of women to work in non-traditional fields and temporary special measures, to achieve de facto equal opportunities for women and men in the labour market and eliminate occupational segregation, both horizontal and vertical, in the public and private sectors,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: ensure that the quotas for female managerial positions are not undermined by inefficient sanctions;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt measures to effectively implement the principle of equal pay for work of equal value and to narrow and close the gender wage gap, including by applying gender-neutral analytical job classification, evaluation methods and regular pay surveys, notably in the civil service, and by ensuring that businesses comply with their legal obligations to develop measures aimed at fostering collective bargaining;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment, including by promoting the equal sharing of domestic and family tasks between men and women,

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment, including by providing more and improved childcare facilities

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Create more opportunities for women to gain access to full-time employment, including by increasing the incentives for men to exercise their right to parental leave;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in employment for disadvantaged women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Take into account the needs of disadvantaged groups of women, especially migrant, refugee, asylum-seeking and Roma women, as well as women belonging to other minority groups and women with disabilities, and consider the use of targeted measures, including temporary special measures, to create further employment opportunities for such groups;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Conduct a comprehensive review of the gendered impact of the new El Khomri Law, with a view to amending all provisions that may discriminate indirectly against women, in particular the provision relating to the principle of neutrality, in order to protect their rights and maintain coherence with previous gender equality legislation;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Revise the tax system and introduce individual taxation of income, at least as an option, and abolish or modify the “family quotient” to make the income tax system gender-neutral rather than a disincentive for participation by women in the labour market;

womensrightsissue: Gender equality in economic and family relations
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Simplify and harmonize the treatment of couples, whether they are married, in a civil partnership or in a de facto union, in tax law and social law;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Address the adverse effects of land acquisition and long-term leases on rural women in the overseas territories and ensure that women are involved in the negotiations of land-lease agreements and that their livelihoods are not negatively affected by such agreements.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: The Committee recommends that the State party increase the use of temporary special measures, including statutory quotas, in all areas covered by the Convention in which women are underrepresented, such as decision-making positions in public administration, the private sector, public companies and academic institutions. The Committee recommends that such measures include specific targets and time frames, in accordance with article 4 (1) of the Convention and its general recommendation No. 25 (2004) on temporary special measures, to ensure the achievement of substantive equality of women and men in all areas of the Convention in which women are disadvantaged or underrepresented.

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Adopt a comprehensive strategy to eliminate discriminatory stereotypes regarding the roles and responsibilities of women and men in the family and in society, which should include a monitoring mechanism to assess the impact of the steps taken and design remedial action;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify engagement with relevant actors and allocate resources to finance effective awareness-raising campaigns to promote positive and non-stereotypical portrayals of women in the media and in advertisements

womensrightsissue: Gender equality and violence against women
documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: conduct a study on the possible impact of sexist portrayals of women and girls in the media and the extent to which they exacerbate gender-based violence against women in the State party;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to combat harmful practices, in particular forced marriage, female genital mutilation and crimes in the name of so-called honour,

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Continue to combat harmful practices, in particular forced marriage, female genital mutilation and crimes in the name of so-called honour, and systematically collect disaggregated data on those harmful practices;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Intensify efforts to combat gender-based violence against women, including domestic violence, by ensuring that prosecutors and police officers are properly trained to identify, investigate and prosecute cases of gender- based violence;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Ensure the effective enforcement of domestic exclusion orders and monitoring with a view to combating repeat offending, which often results in serious forms of gender-based violence;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Systematically collect data on all forms of violence against women, disaggregated by age and the relationship between the perpetrator and the victim, as well as on protection measures, prosecutions and sanctions imposed on perpetrators, in particular in the municipalities of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
recommendation: Evaluate the provision of shelter services and their management by municipal authorities in the light of the merger of child abuse and domestic violence services and provide information in the next periodic report on the impact of such changes;

documenttype: Concluding Comments of the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination Against Women
